0.title: Will hold Twitter board accountable over Musk's bid rejection: US governor
0.article_body: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis has said the state will seek ways to hold Twitter's board "accountable" over the rejection of Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $43 billion bid to buy the platform. The state will hold the board "accountable for breaching their fiduciary duty", he said. "They rejected it because they know that they can't control Elon Musk," DeSantis said.

1.title: SC halts demolition in Delhi's violence-hit Jahangirpuri, orders status quo
1.article_body: Less than an hour after the bulldozers rolled in Jahangirpuri in New Delhi to begin an anti-encroachment drive, the Supreme Court on Wednesday said it would take up the matter for hearing tomorrow and ordered status quo till then. The demolition drive comes days after communal clashes broke out in the area in which at least nine policemen were injured.

2.title: Putin's executioners killed Ukrainian who shares my name: Navalny
2.article_body: Jailed Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny accused Russian President Vladimir Putin's "executioners" of killing a 60-year-old man in Ukraine's Bucha because he shared the Navalny surname. "Apparently, they hoped he was my relative," he said. Navalny shared a picture on Twitter of a passport with the name Ilya Ivanovich Navalny that he said was deliberately left next to the dead body.

3.title: BJP leader held for putting saffron flag in Amravati leading to clash
3.article_body: Police have detained Abhay Matne, BJP’s Achalpur city unit chief and seven to eight persons from the party for allegedly putting up a saffron flag at Dulha Gate on Sunday. According to police, the act of hoisting saffron flag led to a clash between two communities following which a curfew was imposed in Amravati's Achalpur and its twin city Paratwada.

4.title: Youth surrenders for killing neighbour over verbal spat in Vadodara, held
4.article_body: A youth was arrested in Vadodara after he surrendered for allegedly murdering his 47-year-old neighbour in the Danteshwar area of the city. On Tuesday, the deceased got involved in a verbal spat with the accused, according to the police. The deceased allegedly verbally abused the accused’s mother and sister, provoking him to attack, police said.

5.title: North Delhi civic body conducts anti-encroachment drive in Jahangirpuri
5.article_body: North Delhi Municipal Corporation has started conducting an anti-encroachment drive in Jahangirpuri. The drive will be done on illegal construction in the area on April 20 and 21. The civic body has asked for 400 personnel from Delhi Police to maintain the law and order situation during the drive. North-West district DCP Usha Rangnani inspected the area on Wednesday morning.

6.title: Asha remembers sister Lata Mangeshkar on 'Dance...', says 'She's still with me'
6.article_body: In the upcoming episode of 'Dance India Dance Little Masters', singer Asha Bhosle will appear as a guest judge. The channel shared a promo from the upcoming episode, in which two contestants performed imitating Asha and her late sister, singer Lata Mangeshkar. Their performance left Asha Bhosle in tears. She said, "My sister...left this world but she's still with me."

7.title: We're methodically carrying out our plan in eastern Ukraine: Russia
7.article_body: Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu said Russian forces are "methodically carrying out" plans to "liberate" two breakaway regions, Donetsk and Luhansk, in eastern Ukraine. The US and West are trying to prolong Moscow's military operation, he said, adding, "The increasing volume of foreign arms supplies...shows their intentions to provoke the Kyiv regime to fight to the last Ukrainian standing."

8.title: Rishabh Pant's form is going to be very important for DC: Manjrekar
8.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has said Rishabh Pant's form is going to be very important for DC in their upcoming games. "Pant hasn't fired completely...Both Shaw and Warner are high-risk players and there might be a problem if DC lose a couple of early wickets," he explained. So far, Pant hasn't crossed the 50-run mark in their five games.

9.title: BJP has declared war, is punishing Muslims for daring to stay alive: Owaisi
9.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi took to Twitter to say that the Bharatiya Janata Party has declared war against the poorest. "In the name of encroachment it's going to destroy homes in Delhi like UP & MP. No notice, no opportunity to go to court...simply punishing poor Muslims for daring to stay alive...@ArvindKejriwal must clarify his dubious role," the tweet read.

10.title: 1,900 sites inspected for anti-open burning campaign in Delhi: Govt
10.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Tuesday said the government had so far inspected 1,915 sites as part of its anti-open burning campaign. Further, a total of 21 notices or challans have also been issued to violators, he added. The minister said that a high-level meeting to solve Delhi's landfill fire problem will be held on April 21.

11.title: Sidharth Malhotra joins Rohit Shetty's cop universe, shares first picture
11.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra will now be a part of filmmaker Rohit Shetty's cop universe. Sharing a glimpse of his look on Instagram, Sidharth wrote, "Rohit Shetty's cop universe goes digital tomorrow at 11 AM!" Rohit also shared the post and wrote, "Action begins tomorrow." Actor Anupam Kher wished him luck and commented on the picture, "Good luck, my friend!"

12.title: Nazara to acquire 35% stake in Brandscale Innovations for ₹10 cr
12.article_body: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed gaming platform Nazara Technologies' arm Nodwin Gaming's board has approved the acquisition of 35% stake in Brandscale Innovations for around ₹10 crore. Nazara has also invested in gaming accessories brand Wings, which designs and deals in high-quality and affordable gaming audio gear. Earlier, Nazara announced it will be investing ₹18 cr in US-based Bitkraft Ventures.

13.title: UP couple injured in blast in J&K's Rajouri
13.article_body: A married couple from Uttar Pradesh sustained injuries after what the police are calling a "mysterious explosion" took place near a slum in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district on Tuesday. The victims were identified as 25-year-old Vinod Kumar and 20-year-old Kranti Devi. The two were said to be stable after being hospitalised, according to police.

14.title: 6 TRS leaders held in mother-son suicide case in Telangana
14.article_body: At least six leaders of Telangana's ruling party Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS), including Ramayampet Municipal Chairman Palle Jitender Goud, were arrested in a mother-son suicide case. They were accused of abetting the suicide of a real estate businessman and his mother in Kamareddy, police said. The victims had set themselves ablaze, accusing TRS leaders and a circle inspector of harassment.

15.title: 2 terror accused met Pak Army Major seen in pic with IAF pilot Abhinandan: Delhi Police
15.article_body: Two men arrested by Delhi Police on terror charges have allegedly identified a Pakistani Army Major whom they had met while undergoing training by ISI in Pakistan. They identified "Major Hamza" from a photograph shown of IAF Group Captain Abhinandan Varthaman who was in Pakistani custody for a brief spell three years ago, according to a chargesheet filed in court.

16.title: Rainfall, thunderstorm predicted in several states; list released
16.article_body: The IMD has predicted fairly widespread rainfall over Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, Tripura, Sikkim, and Sub-Himalayan West Bengal during the next four days. Under the influence of a Western Disturbance, light isolated rainfall with thunderstorms, lightning, gusty winds likely over Punjab and Haryana, and Delhi on April 20 and 21.

17.title: Russian army is most barbaric and inhuman: Ukraine Prez
17.article_body: The Russian army is writing itself into history forever as the most barbaric and inhuman army in the world, said Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. "They have driven almost everyone and everything that is capable of fighting us against Ukraine," he said in a video address to his country. The Russians are not allowing humanitarian corridors, he added.

18.title: Bodies of Nepalese woman, infant found hanging in Shimla's Ratnari
18.article_body: The bodies of a Nepalese woman and her nine-month-old child were found hanging in Shimla's Ratnari village, the police said. The woman's husband found the bodies when he returned from work and took down the bodies before the arrival of the police. The family is originally from Nepal and worked in an apple orchard in Shimla.

19.title: Actor Ezra Miller throws chair at woman, arrested for second-degree assault
19.article_body: Days after being arrested on charges of disorderly conduct and harassment at a bar in Hawaii, actor Ezra Miller, who portrayed The Flash in DC's 'Justice League', was arrested again for a second-degree assault. Miller was arrested after he threw a chair at a 26-year-old woman on being asked to leave a get-together. Police are investigating the matter.

20.title: It took 10 years: Taapsee on working with Shah Rukh Khan in 'Dunki'
20.article_body: Speaking about working with Shah Rukh Khan and filmmaker Rajkumar Hirani in 'Dunki', Taapsee Pannu took to Twitter to share her excitement. She wrote, "A superstar once said...'When you wish for something with all your heart...entire universe conspires to get it for you.' Cheers to honesty, hard work and perseverance. It took 10 years but finally 'All is Well'."

21.title: Dad started work at 15, left house with ₹20; mom restarted career at 56: Karan
21.article_body: Actor Karan Kundrra said that he is privileged because his father started working at the age of 15 and left house with ₹20. Karan added that his mother restarted her career as a registered nurse in the US. "When parents got married, my dad went back to his Air Force base and mom went to her hostel," he further said.

22.title: Govt to run check on those coming for Char Dham Yatra: U'khand CM
22.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said those coming to the state on Char Dham Yatra will have to undergo proper verification so that those who may pose a threat to peace are kept out. "Our state is a peaceful state...Those doing riots, creating enmity or spreading hate in the name of religion do not have any place here," Dhami stated.

23.title: The bounce was unreal with the new ball: Hazlewood on 4/25 vs LSG
23.article_body: RCB pacer Josh Hazlewood said the bounce was unreal at the DY Patil Stadium and it helped him to create opportunities to take wickets in the first few overs against LSG. "If you get it right you can create opportunities...We have got a well-rounded bowling attack," he added. Hazlewood picked four wickets, conceding 25 runs in the game.

24.title: Maha seeks removal of 22 social media accounts with 'communal disharmony posts'
24.article_body: The Maharashtra Cyber Cell has proposed to block 22 social media accounts for "propagating communal disharmony" in the wake of communal clashes incidents reported in some states. On observing the current atmosphere (of the country), 48 police stations under the department are actively filtering out accounts that post objectionable and defamatory content, a senior police officer said.

25.title: Man dies in police custody in Bhubaneswar, 2 women claim body
25.article_body: A man, identified as Pradip Sahu by the police who was caught in a cycle theft case, died in police custody in Odisha's Bhubaneswar, officials said. A woman claimed that the man was not Sahu but her husband, Devendra Choudhary. Notably, another woman also reached the police station to claim the man's body and said that he is her husband.

26.title: Elon Musk willing to invest up to $15 billion of own money to buy Twitter: Report
26.article_body: Elon Musk is willing to invest between $10 billion and $15 billion of his own money to take Twitter Inc private, the New York Post reported citing two sources. The Tesla CEO and world's richest man, who is Twitter's second-biggest shareholder with a 9.1% stake, is planning to launch an offer in about 10 days, the report added.

27.title: Hopefully a hundred is around the corner: Du Plessis on 96(64) vs LSG
27.article_body: RCB captain Faf Du Plessis, who scored 96(64) runs against LSG, said someone had to stabilise their innings after they lost two early wickets and he's grateful that he could do that. He added that he has scored a few fifty-plus scores now and "hopefully (a ton) is around the corner". Earlier, Plessis scored 88 in their match against PBKS.

28.title: Pups bit Arnav with sharp teeth, it was bleeding: Arun Vijay on Oh My Dog
28.article_body: Actor Arun Vijay said that pups started biting his on and off screen son Arnav Vijay with "sharp teeth" during shoot of 'Oh My Dog'. "He handled it so well...He had no problems with scratches on his hands...it was bleeding...He just put on some sanitiser and then he just went and started doing it again...because he loves dogs," Arun added.

29.title: 50 tonnes of raw material gutted as fire breaks out in Ahmedabad godown
29.article_body: Over 50 tonnes of industrial raw material was gutted in a fire that broke out at Kapsun Resource Corp company's godown in an industrial area near Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Tuesday. The company manufactures industrial water coolers. "Nine water tankers, one fire fighting tanker...over 40 firefighting personnel were rushed to the spot," an official said. No casualty or injury was reported.

30.title: RSS, PFI should be dealt with firmly if they create communal unrest: CPI(M) leader
30.article_body: CPI(M) Kerala State Secretary Kodiyeri Balakrishnan said that ban on communal outfits was not a solution to check the growing "communal virus" in the country. Speaking about RSS and SDPI workers' killings in Palakkad, he said that the crimes were well-planned. "Both, RSS and PFI, should be dealt with firmly if they create communal unrest," Balakrishnan added.

31.title: German park renames boar called Putin over Ukraine war
31.article_body: A wild boar, named Putin after the Russian President, got a new name after the authorities at a German animal park decided that the old one was getting uncomfortable following the start of the Ukraine war. After an online poll, the animal, a purebred Russian hog, was renamed as "Eberhofer". Ukrainian names such as Zelenskyy and Klitschko were also suggested.

32.title: A narrative of fine fabrics hand-stitched to perfection: Raymond
32.article_body:
Raymond announced that as India's leading men's fashion brand, it has introduced a fascinating line of fine fabrics to create delightful silhouettes for various celebratory occasions. 
The moments of joy with family deserve an immaculately stylised wardrobe, the brand stated, adding that every fabric from this collection is hand-stitched to perfection, thus making precious moments truly memorable.

33.title: Life on Mars will not be luxurious, it will be difficult: Elon Musk
33.article_body: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk in an interview with TED head Chris Anderson discussed life on Mars, saying that life there "will not be luxurious", especially in the beginning. "The sales pitch for going to Mars is, 'It's dangerous, it's cramped. You might not make it back. It's difficult, it's hard work,'" Musk said.

34.title: India sees 2,067 new COVID-19 cases, over 65% rise in daily cases
34.article_body: India has reported 2,067 new COVID-19 cases, 1,547 recoveries and 40 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country saw 1,247 cases and one death. Active COVID-19 cases in India rose to 12,340, while the death toll reached 5,22,006.

35.title: Which bowlers have dismissed Virat Kohli for golden duck in IPL history?
35.article_body: Virat Kohli on Tuesday got out for a golden duck for the fourth time in IPL. Kohli was dismissed by LSG's Dushmantha Chameera. Kohli's first golden duck in IPL came against MI on May 28, 2008, when he was dismissed by Ashish Nehra. Sandeep Sharma and Nathan Coulter-Nile got Kohli out for a first-ball duck in 2014 and 2017, respectively.

36.title: DCP inspects Jahangirpuri area ahead of anti-encroachment drive
36.article_body: Delhi's North-West district DCP Usha Rangnani on Wednesday morning inspected the Jahangirpuri area ahead of the anti-encroachment drive announced by the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD). This comes after MCD asked for 400 personnel from Delhi Police to handle law and order during the drive. The drive will be done on illegal construction in Jahangirpuri on April 20 and 21.

37.title: 26-year-old man arrested in Pune for murder of 8-year-old child
37.article_body: A 26-year-old man has been arrested for the murder of an eight-year-old child in Pune. The child was reported missing on Sunday and was later found in an unused accommodation a few metres from his house. Police said, "The reports about attempted sexual assault are untrue [and] so far, the motive appears to be money, but it cannot be confirmed."

38.title: No innocent person should be booked in Jahangirpuri violence: Minorities panel
38.article_body: A National Commission for Minorities delegation led by Chairperson Iqbal Singh Lalpura visited Delhi’s violence-hit Jahangirpuri area. The delegation called upon the administration to ensure that no innocent person is booked in the matter and requested to quickly nab the culprits involved in the violence. The delegation took stock of the situation from DCP North West.

39.title: Anupam Kher meets The Great Khali in Delhi, shares pic of himself standing on chair
39.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with former WWE wrestler The Great Khali. Sharing a picture of himself standing on a chair alongside The Great Khali, Anupam wrote on Instagram, "The only way one can be taller than The Great Khali is [this]." "That's a great formula," a user commented on the picture.

40.title: Jahangirpuri arms supplier arrested after encounter, has over 60 cases: Delhi Police
40.article_body: An arms supplier from Delhi's Jahangirpuri area has been nabbed after a brief encounter in which he was injured, said DCP Outer North Brijendra Yadav to ANI on Wednesday. According to DCP Yadav, he is named in more than 60 previous cases. Nine policemen and a civilian were injured in clashes during a Hanuman Jayanti procession in Jahangirpuri on Saturday.

41.title: Russian forces steal Ukraine man's AirPods, he uses them to track their movement
41.article_body: A Ukrainian man has been tracking the redeployment of Russia forces via AirPods stolen from him by invading troops. Vitaliy Semenets' AirPods were looted from his home in Hostomel, near Kyiv, soon after the war began as Russia tried to take the Ukrainian capital. He has since been using Find My app to track the movement of Russian forces.

42.title: Can't get out of bed sometimes; it gets difficult: Sonam on pregnancy
42.article_body: Speaking about her pregnancy, actress Sonam Kapoor said her sleep pattern has got disrupted and that she's unable to fulfil her work obligation. "No one warns you how difficult it'll be, but it'll be difficult," she added. "I can't sleep sometimes...I'm...an early riser and it was like [it's] 8:30 AM and I just couldn't get out of bed," Sonam said.

43.title: 11 yrs ago, Adi said look test was my world cup final's penalty kick: Ranveer
43.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh recalled his 'Band Baaja Baaraat' look test that happened 11 years ago. "Adi sir (Aditya Chopra) had told me that this is my world cup final's penalty kick. [He said] 'If you score in this, you are a champion and if not, you can go back home'. Right here. What a moment to remember," he added.

44.title: B'luru records excess rainfall of 151 mm since Mar 1, to receive more showers
44.article_body: India Meteorological Department on Tuesday said Bengaluru would continue to receive scattered rainfall for the next few days. Maximum and minimum temperatures are likely to be around 33°C and 21°C for the next two days, IMD predicted. Bengaluru has recorded 151 mm rainfall from March 1 to April 19, it added, saying, "The city has received excess rainfall so far."

45.title: 72% Mumbai mosques complying with noise rules: Police
45.article_body: Nearly 72 percent of mosques in Mumbai are complying with noise pollution rules and have either stopped using loudspeakers or are keeping their sound very low during azaan, as per Mumbai Police's survey. People have started sending applications seeking permission to use loudspeakers but permission will be granted only if it meets all security parameters, a police officer said.

46.title: Stopped publishing bulletin, sending mails: Kerala Health Min on COVID data
46.article_body: Allegations that Kerala is not giving COVID-19 data to the Centre are absolutely wrong, state Health Minister Veena George said. "We've stopped publishing daily bulletin in the state...have been sending mails," she added. "It's quite unfortunate...a responsible person from Union government is sending letter to Principal Secretary stating that Kerala is not giving data to the Centre," Veena stated.

47.title: Centre’s regressive policies dampening farm sector growth: KCR
47.article_body: Calling the Centre's policies on agriculture regressive, Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Tuesday said that they are dampening the growth of the farm sector in the country. He said that the policies would reduce output instead of boosting it. His remarks came in a meeting with the state Agriculture Minister and officials to assess preparedness for rainy season crops.

48.title: Bodies of man, woman tied together by waist found in Narmada canal in Guj
48.article_body: The bodies of a man and woman were recovered from Narmada main canal near Gadit village in Gujarat's Halol. Police said they haven't been identified yet as no evidence was found on them. "It appears to be a prima facie case of...suicide," police added. The bodies were first spotted near Rameshra but were swept away towards Halol with the current.

49.title: Mumbai to witness high tides on 22 days this monsoon season: BMC
49.article_body: Mumbai will witness 22 days of high tide in four months of monsoon this year, according to BMC's Disaster Management Authority. High tides will occur on six days each in June and July and five days each in August and September, the data showed. The highest tide of 4.87 metres is expected on one day each in June and July.

50.title: Delhi's Ashram underpass to fully open to public on April 24
50.article_body: The 750-metre-long Ashram underpass in Delhi will be fully open to the public from April 24. The underpass, connecting central and south Delhi, will be inaugurated by Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Sunday. "At present, traffic movement is allowed till 11 pm. Once the underpass is officially inaugurated, it will be open [throughout] the day." a PWD official said.

51.title: Aus scientists to power Tesla on 15,000-km trip with printed solar panels
51.article_body: Australian scientists will test using printed solar panels to run a Tesla on a 15,100-kilometre journey beginning in September. The team will use 18 of its printed plastic solar panels, each 18 metres (59 feet) long. They will roll out the panels beside the car to absorb sunlight when the car will be in need of a charge.

52.title: Posing as customers, 3 women, 1 man steal gold earrings & pendants in Punjab
52.article_body: Three women and one man allegedly stole two pairs of gold earrings and two pendants from jewellery shop in Ludhiana while posing as customers. Fraudsters allegedly engaged jeweller in conversation and also sent his employee to fetch water for them. They asked owner to show nose rings and earrings and pretended to not like anything before leaving with stolen jewellery.

53.title: Could've done better with bowling, RCB's 181 was 15-20 extra runs: Rahul
53.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul said they could've done better as they lost by 18 runs against RCB on Tuesday. "We started really well after getting two wickets in the first over...but [RCB's 181-run total] on [this] pitch was 15-20 extra runs we gave away...we couldn't really squeeze in the middle and with the bat as well," he added.

54.title: Bombay HC judge recuses from Elgar case, third to do so this year
54.article_body: Bombay High Court Justice Sadhana S Jadhav recused herself from hearing pleas related to the Bhima Koregaon-Elgar Parishad case in which several writers and activists are accused. Jadhav is the third judge to do so this year after Justice Prasanna B Varale and Justice S S Shinde recused themselves from hearing pleas related to the case.

55.title: Hyderabad Police busts organised cricket betting racket, 4 arrested
55.article_body: Hyderabad City Police busted an organised cricket betting racket and arrested four people. They seized seven cell phones, a TV with a setup box and remotes, one calculator, one notebook, one pen and ₹2.80 lakh in cash. A raid was conducted when the accused were running cricket betting in an organised manner in Venkateshwar Nagar, police said.

56.title: Ram Charan visits BSF camp in Amritsar; gets his personal chef to cook for them
56.article_body: Ram Charan, who is currently shooting for filmmaker Shankar's yet-to-be-titled upcoming film, spent the afternoon with the soldiers of the Border Security Force (BSF) in Khasa, Amritsar. Reportedly, Ram brought his personal chef to cook meal for all the soldiers on the campus. Sharing the pictures from the Amritsar's BSF campus, Ram wrote, "Inspiring afternoon spent listening to stories."

57.title: Ajay pranked crew during Runway 34's shoot; added Bhang in lassi: Hrishikesh
57.article_body: Actor Hrishikesh Pandey, who'll be seen in 'Runway 34', spoke about working with actor-director Ajay Devgn in the film. He said, "I wasn't expecting him to be so sweet...and wonderful. I thought he'd be stern and cut to cut." "Ajay sir is known as a prankster. On April Fool's Day, he added bhang in lassi, which everyone had," Hrishikesh added.

58.title: Wrote comedy on arrest, jokes came to mind as I reached police station: Munawar
58.article_body: Comedian and 'Lock Upp' contestant Munawar Faruqui said that he started writing his new comedy special on his arrest when he went to jail. "Jokes had started coming to my mind...when I reached the police station...I was in a very very bad condition...They were the worst days of my life...I was observing everything...and writing jokes about them," he added.

59.title: Indian Air Force successfully test fires BrahMos missile from Sukhoi Su-30MKI jet
59.article_body: The Indian Air Force (IAF) on Tuesday successfully test-fired a BrahMos supersonic cruise missile from a Sukhoi Su-30MKI jet on the Eastern seaboard. The "live firing" of the missile was carried out in close coordination with the Indian Navy, the IAF said. The missile hit the target, a decommissioned Indian Navy ship, with accuracy and precision, officials said.

60.title: Ghaziabad earned ₹1,474 cr in liquor revenue in 2021-22, 3rd highest in UP
60.article_body: Ghaziabad earned ₹1,474 crore in liquor revenue in financial year 2021-22 which was the third-highest in UP behind Lucknow and Kanpur, excise department officials said. Ghaziabad residents consumed over 2.88 crore bottles of beer and over 1.30 crore bottles of Indian Made Foreign Liquor. "Revenue earned from liquor in 2021-22 has been the highest in five years," an official said.

61.title: 2 contract killers arrested in murder of 25-year-old man in Thane
61.article_body: Police have arrested two contract killers in the murder of a 25-year-old man in Thane. According to police, the deceased, identified as Mangesh Patil, had become a hurdle for his three relatives on their ancestral property issues in the Shil-Daighar area. Therefore, in order to get Patil killed, his relatives gave a contract of ₹50,000 to the killers, police added.

62.title: CSK players attend Conway's pre-wedding party wearing traditional attire, pics surface
62.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) contingent attended New Zealand batter Devon Conway's pre-wedding party wearing traditional attire in Mumbai's Trident Hotel. "Honestly a night I’ll never forget! Thank you so much to the CSK family for a lovely evening! Now onto the big day ahead," Conway wrote on Instagram. Conway and his longtime girlfriend Kim had got engaged in 2020.

63.title: Maria Sharapova pregnant with first child, shares pic of baby bump
63.article_body: Ex-world number one women's tennis player Maria Sharapova has announced that she's pregnant with her first child. Sharapova, who turned 35 on Tuesday, shared a picture of her baby bump on Instagram, writing, "Precious beginnings...Eating birthday cake for two has always been my specialty." The five-time Grand Slam champion got engaged to UK art dealer Alexander Gilkes in December 2020.

64.title: Netflix loses subscribers for 1st time in more than 10 years
64.article_body: The number of Netflix subscribers has fallen for the first time in more than a decade. The streaming company lost 200,000 members in the first three months of the year, the company said on Tuesday. Netflix's shares, already down more than 40% this year, tumbled as much as 27% to $256 in after-hours trading.

65.title: RCB go 2nd on IPL 2022 points table with 18-run win against LSG
65.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) defeated Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) by 18 runs to register their second win in a row. With this, RCB jumped to the second position on the IPL 2022 points table, while LSG have dropped to the fourth position. RCB captain Faf du Plessis top-scored in the match with 96(64), while Josh Hazlewood took four wickets.

66.title: 2 ex-business partners get into a fight, injured in shootout in WB
66.article_body: Two former business partners were injured in a shootout in West Bengal's Kolkata at Brahmapur area. Locals claimed it was the fallout of a TMC syndicate fight. However, the local councillor said, "There was personal enmity between the two and the firing took place due to personal problems."

67.title: 6.0 magnitude earthquake strikes Philippines' Mindanao island
67.article_body: The European Mediterranean Seismological Centre (EMSC) on Tuesday said a 6.0 magnitude earthquake struck the Mindanao island in the Philippines. No injuries or damage have been reported so far. The EMSC said the quake was recorded at a depth of 10 km. The Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology said aftershocks and damage are expected following the earthquake.

68.title: Captain of large Russian landing ship killed in Ukraine: Reports
68.article_body: The captain of a large Russian landing ship has reportedly been killed in Ukraine. Governor of Sevastopol Mikhail Razvozhayev said Captain Alexander Chirva died from wounds he sustained during a battle with Ukrainian defenders. Captain Chirva was the commander of the Russian landing ship Caesar Kunikov which is a part of Russia's Black Sea fleet.

69.title: Maharashtra reports 137 new COVID-19 cases, three deaths
69.article_body: Maharashtra, on Tuesday, logged 137 new COVID-19 cases taking its tally to 78,76,041, the latest health department bulletin showed. There were three casualties reported as well, pushing the overall death tally to 1,47,830, according to the bulletin. Out of three new deaths in Maharashtra, Pune accounted for two deaths while Parbhani saw a single fatality.

70.title: Real estate prices may increase by 10-15% across India: CREDAI
70.article_body: Real estate industry body CREDAI on Tuesday said real estate prices have increased 5-8% due to a rise in construction costs and are expected to rise further by 5-7%, CREDAI National President HV Patodia said. There's been a steady increase in raw material costs in last two years and the Ukraine war further caused a rise in costs, he added.

71.title: Live-in relationships are leading to rise in sexual offences: MP High Court
71.article_body: The "bane of live-in relationship", a "byproduct" of rights conferred under Article 21 of the Constitution, is leading to a rise in sexual offences, Madhya Pradesh High Court said. It made the observation while rejecting anticipatory bail plea of a man accused of raping a woman. The complainant got pregnant and underwent abortions under pressure from her then partner.

72.title: Assam authorities alert districts to be prepared to tackle floods
72.article_body: The government of Assam has started the preparations to deal with the flood situation and alerted all the districts to be ready as well. "We have identified locations based on the last 10 years' flood data [and]...identified 11 circles that are spread over five districts that receive floods almost every year," CEO of Assam State Disaster Management Authority said.

73.title: Odisha CM Patnaik sanctions ₹120 cr for Kendu leaf pluckers
73.article_body: Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik sanctioned ₹120 crore for bonus and other allowances for Kendu leaf pluckers and other seasonal workers. A statement from the Chief Minister's office said, "It will benefit around 8 lakh Kendu leaf pluckers, binders and other seasonal staff." The state government also decided to increase the collection price of Kendu leaf for 2022.

74.title: US President Joe Biden should come to Ukraine: President Zelenskyy
74.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said US President Joe Biden "should come" to visit Ukraine. "It's his decision of course and they must consider the safety situation. But I think he's the leader of the United States and that's why he should come here to see," Zelenskyy said. The White House has since stated Biden has "no plans" to visit Ukraine.

75.title: MHA designates LeT commander Sheikh Sajad as terrorist under UAPA
75.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs designated Sheikh Sajad, a commander of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT), as a terrorist under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act. The ministry stated in a notification that Sajad has been absconding in a case related to the recovery of arms and ammunition in Jammu and Kashmir. He has also been recruiting the youth of J&K into LeT.

76.title: Sri Lankan PM offers to hold talks with anti-govt protesters
76.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa on Tuesday offered to hold talks with anti-government protesters amid a severe economic crisis in Sri Lanka. Earlier, the protesters had said that they would only leave if PM Rajapaksa and President Gotabaya Rajapaksa step down. Notably, the opposition has threatened to bring a no-confidence motion against the government over its handling of the crisis.

77.title: Electric chopsticks that can make food taste saltier developed in Japan
77.article_body: Researchers in Japan claim that they have developed computerised chopsticks that can make food taste saltier, in a "world first". Co-developed by Meiji University professor Homei Miyashita and beverage maker Kirin Holdings, the device uses electrical stimulation and is attached to a mini wristband computer. The chopsticks can potentially help people reduce their salt intake, the researchers said.

78.title: He was the cement that build RCB innings: Jaffer on Du Plessis' 96 vs LSG
78.article_body: After RCB captain Faf du Plessis' 64-ball 96 helped his side post 181/6 in 20 overs against LSG in IPL 2022, Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "From 21*(20) to 50*(40) to 96(64). Faf was the cement that build RCB innings." He added, "Masterclass in how to rebuild after an early collapse." RCB were reduced to 7/2 after the first over.

79.title: Cong isn't dead, will play role of constructive opp'n in Punjab: Sidhu
79.article_body: Former Punjab Congress chief Navjot Singh Sidhu, while speaking about the party's loss in the state Assembly elections this year, said that the "Congress party has lost but isn't dead". He added that Congress will be playing the role of a constructive opposition in Punjab and that they will "work to provide the solution to the problems of people".

80.title: 12 states face power crisis due to coal shortage: Maha Minister
80.article_body: Maharashtra Energy Minister Nitin Raut said that 12 states are facing electricity issues due to the shortage of coal and that his department was working to mitigate the shortage. "Shortage is also due to lack of rakes (trains). We require 37 rakes per day, while we get only 26. Each rake can transport 4,000 metric tonnes of coal," Raut said.

81.title: Hubballi rioters will be tried as per existing law: Karnataka CM
81.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai has said that those involved in the Hubballi riots will be tried as per the existing laws in the state. "When riots took place in Uttar Pradesh, certain action was taken according to the situation prevailing over there. We are reviewing the situation in Karnataka. We will go by our law," Bommai said.

82.title: Ayodhya's security increased along with Ram Temple: Report
82.article_body: Ahead of the final stage of completion of the plinth at the Ram Temple, the security in Ayodhya has been reportedly increased. Entire city has been reportedly kept under the surveillance of CCTV cameras and soldiers have been deployed on watchtowers to monitor people. According to the report, the city will also get a new control room for security.

83.title: 22-yr-old techie's laptop catches fire in Andhra, she suffers 80% burns
83.article_body: A 22-year-old software engineer from Andhra Pradesh suffered around 80% burns after the laptop she was working on triggered a fire, police said. The incident took place on Monday when sparks from Sumalatha's laptop, which was being charged, caused a fire that spread rapidly in her room. As per a preliminary probe, the fire originated from the laptop's charger adapter.

84.title: PM Modi shares pic after meeting Jam Saheb Shatrusalyasinh; Poland reacts
84.article_body: PM Narendra Modi met Jam Saheb Shatrusalyasinh in Gujarat's Jamnagar and wrote, "The goodwill of Jam Saheb's family is spread all over the world, especially in Europe." Responding to his tweet, Poland's envoy Adam Burakowski tweeted, "PM of India...visited Jam Saheb, son of Jam Saheb Digvijay Sinhji who during II World War hosted c.a. 800 Polish children in Balachadi."

85.title: ₹2.58 lakh crore wiped off HDFC & HDFC Bank's market value in 9-day sell-off
85.article_body: As much as ₹2.58 lakh crore has been wiped out of the combined market value of HDFC Ltd and HDFC Bank in a nine-day sell-off. The development comes after the two companies announced their merger earlier this month. HDFC Ltd, which was among India's top 10 most valuable companies prior to the announcement, is no longer on the list.

86.title: Anguished by the tragic accident in Jhunjhunu: PM Narendra Modi
86.article_body: PM Narendra Modi expressed anguish and offered condolences over the road accident in Jhunjhunu, Rajasthan, where 11 members of a family were killed and several others injured after a jeep rammed into a tractor trolley. PM Modi tweeted, "₹2 lakh each from PMNRF would be given to the next of family of the deceased. The injured would be given ₹50,000."

87.title: No 'COVID-19 tax' was levied on anybody in India: FM Nirmala Sitharaman
87.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman during her US visit on Monday said, "No 'COVID-19 tax' was levied on anybody (in India)." She said, "The one big step the government decided was we shall not tax people to get out of the pandemic." Calling the building of infrastructure "best multiplier for economic recovery", she added, "Capital expenditure was our route to recovery."

88.title: UK PM apologises for attending surprise b'day party amid lockdown after being fined
88.article_body: British PM Boris Johnson has offered an apology for attending illegal party during lockdown, but said he didn't knowingly break rules or mislead Parliament. Johnson told lawmakers that "it did not occur to me" that the gathering was a party. Last week, Johnson was fined £50 for attending his own surprise birthday party at his official residence in June 2020.

89.title: UN chief calls for 4-day pause to fighting in Ukraine
89.article_body: UN Secretary-General António Guterres has called for a four-day "humanitarian pause to the war in Ukraine" ahead of Orthodox Easter on Sunday. "The onslaught and terrible toll on civilians we've seen so far could pale in comparison to the horror that lies ahead. This cannot be allowed to happen," he said. The war has sparked a humanitarian crisis in Ukraine.

90.title: 5 grenades, 10 pistols among the arms recovered from J&K's Kupwara
90.article_body: A huge cache of arms and ammunition was reportedly recovered from Kupwara district during a search operation conducted by the police along with the Indian Army. Ten pistols, 17 pistol magazines, 54 pistol rounds and five grenades were seized, the police said. On Sunday, the J&K police along with the Army arrested a suspected terrorist and seized ammunition from him.

91.title: My parents love that I am wearing a uniform in 'Runway 34': Rakul
91.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh has said that her parents "love" that she is wearing a uniform in her upcoming film 'Runway 34'. "I have grown up with people in uniform around me," she stated. Rakul added her father gives her critical reviews of her films. "For me, they (her parents) are the public; I get..best reviews from them," Rakul said.

92.title: 23-year-old Mumbai student arrested for selling child pornography
92.article_body: A 23-year-old student from Mumbai was arrested for collecting child pornographic materials, which he sold via the messaging application Telegram, the police said. The Maharashtra cyber-police department had registered an FIR on April 5, after a complaint from an activist who reported it to the police. The accused has been booked under the Information Technology Act, they added.

93.title: Virat Kohli goes 100 professional matches without scoring a hundred
93.article_body: India and RCB batter Virat Kohli has now gone 100 professional matches without scoring a hundred. Kohli, who got out for a golden duck against LSG today, has played 17 Tests, 21 ODIs, 25 T20Is and 37 IPL matches since scoring his previous hundred in November 2019. Kohli's previous hundred came in a Test against Bangladesh.

94.title: Actor Bob Odenkirk honoured with the Hollywood Walk of Fame star
94.article_body: Actor Bob Odenkirk has been honoured with the Hollywood Walk of Fame star on Monday. Jonathan Banks, Patrick Fabian, Tony Dalton, Giancarlo Esposito, Patrick Fabian, and Michael Mando attended the ceremony. The actor is known for his work in 'Breaking Bad', 'Better Call Saul'. Bob's star was placed next to Bryan Cranston, who was Bob's co-star in 'Breaking Bad'.

95.title: Ukraine denies attacking Russian border village amid ongoing war
95.article_body: Ukraine on Tuesday denied accusations by a Russian provincial governor that it had attacked a border village amid countries' ongoing conflict. Vyacheslav Gladkov, Governor of Russian province of Belgorod had accused Ukrainian forces of wounding three people and damaging as many as 30 houses in alleged attack. "Ukraine is conducting a defence operation on its territory," Ukrainian military said.

96.title: Greece impounds oil tanker as part of EU sanctions against Russia
96.article_body: Greece on Tuesday said that it has impounded a Russian oil tanker off the island of Evia. The move is part of efforts by Greece to enforce European Union (EU) sanctions on Russia over its invasion of Ukraine. Earlier this month, the EU had banned Russian-flagged vessels from its ports with some exemptions.

97.title: RCB can make it to the top-four in IPL 2022: Jaffer
97.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said RCB have the team to make it to the top four in IPL 2022. "Form of Dinesh Karthik has been excellent, Glenn Maxwell has come back to form...Shahbaz Ahamad has been playing sensible cricket," he added. Jaffer further said that RCB's bowling looks settled with the presence of Josh Hazlewood and Harshal Patel.

98.title: BSF recovers 2.1 kg of suspected heroin near border in Punjab
98.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) in Punjab's Amritsar sector on Tuesday recovered four packets containing 2.1 kg of suspected heroin along with a pistol, a magazine and 37 Rds. Sharing a picture of the items on Twitter, Punjab Frontier BSF wrote that the recovery was made by the troops while "monitoring harvesting activities of farmers ahead of border fence".

99.title: Oil drops below the $110 mark after IMF cuts global growth forecast
99.article_body: Oil price dipped below the $110 mark on Tuesday after the International Monetary Fund (IMF) reduced its global growth forecast and warned of higher inflation. Brent crude fell $3.94 to $109.22/barrel while US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) fell $3.8 to $104.41/barrel. IMF had said growth in emerging markets and developed economies could reduce by 1.3% and 0.9% over three years.

100.title: LSG skipper KL Rahul has improved his leadership qualities: Jaffer
100.article_body: Talking about KL Rahul, who previously led PBKS in IPL, Wasim Jaffer said the LSG captain's leadership is getting better with time. "I had been involved with Punjab team in the last two years and think he's a phenomenal player and has scored runs against all teams," he added. LSG are currently third on points table in IPL 2022.

101.title: He touched our hearts: PM Modi after WHO chief greets public in Gujarati
101.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has thanked WHO chief Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus for speaking in Gujarati, Hindi and English during an inaugural ceremony of the WHO-Global Centre for Traditional Medicine in Jamnagar. PM Modi said, "[Tedros] made us feel 'Triveni'...and touched our hearts by speaking in Gujarati, Hindi and English." Tedros had greeted public asking, "Kem cho? Majama? (How're you? Fine?)"

102.title: 13,964 posts removed due to increasing communal tension: Mumbai Police
102.article_body: Around 13,964 social media posts have been deleted in the last four months due to an increase in communal tension and violence in the country, the Mumbai Police said. The special branch of Mumbai Police deleted 5,754 posts in January, 4,252 posts in February and 3,958 social media posts in March.

103.title: Russia expels 15 Dutch envoys in retaliatory move amid Ukraine war
103.article_body: Russia on Tuesday expelled 15 Dutch diplomats from the country, its Foreign Ministry said. Among those expelled, 14 persons were employees at the Dutch embassy in Moscow and one was a staffer at the Dutch Consulate General in St. Petersburg. The move comes in response to the expulsion of 17 Russian envoys in the Netherlands last month amid Ukraine invasion.

104.title: Centre writes to 4 states & Delhi amid rise in COVID-19 cases, positivity rate
104.article_body: Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan has written to Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, Delhi, Maharashtra and Mizoram on the increasing coronavirus positivity rate and cases in these places. India recorded 1,247 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday. Delhi has been recording over 500 COVID-19 cases for the past three days with a positivity rate of over 4%.

105.title: Kindergartener brings tequila to school, gets classmates drunk in US
105.article_body: A kindergartener aged between three and six allegedly brought a tequila-based drink to school in US' Michigan and shared it with friends, who thought it was juice. Several students reported feeling "dizzy" and "woozy" after consuming the alcoholic drink. "I had a small conversation with my daughter...and she told me the girl knew it was liquor," a parent said.

106.title: There's no ideal body type in entertainment industry: Palak Tiwari
106.article_body: Palak Tiwari said there's no ideal body type in the entertainment industry. "We live in India, an ideal body type is a size medium but people fat shame...size medium. When you are too skinny, they have an issue," she stated. "It's..same toxic circle of people never being happy...don't think it makes any sense paying heed to that," Palak added.

107.title: Need more matches to achieve desired level of tennis: Djokovic
107.article_body: Ahead of Serbia Open second round, Novak Djokovic said he needs more matches to achieve desired level of tennis after exiting early in two tournaments he has played in 2022 season thus far. The world number one added that French Open is his "biggest goal" on clay and he hopes to play more matches in Belgrade than in Monte Carlo.

108.title: LV Vaidyanathan, who joined P&G as an intern, appointed India CEO
108.article_body: Consumer goods company Procter & Gamble (P&G) on Tuesday announced that it has appointed LV Vaidyanathan as the CEO for its operations in India. Vaidyanathan is an alumnus of IIM Ahmedabad and had joined P&G as an intern in 1995. The 49-year-old is currently leading the P&G business in Indonesia. Vaidyanathan succeeds Madhusudan Gopalan, who'll move to a global role.

109.title: 2 men sentenced to 14 yrs in jail for trafficking minors in Jaipur
109.article_body: A special court in Jaipur on Tuesday sentenced two men to 14 years in jail for trafficking minors and forcing them into child labour. The accused had trafficked at least 33 children from Bihar, who were rescued during a police raid in the city in 2018. A fine of ₹5.64 lakh has also been imposed on each of the accused.

110.title: 'Beta apne ghar par dhyan do': Suniel to troll over his remark after KL Rahul's hundred
110.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty responded to a troll's remark after LSG captain KL Rahul smashed a hundred in his 100th IPL match against MI on Saturday. Suniel had shared an appreciation post, on which the troll commented how in the absence of Suniel and his family, KL Rahul was able to score a century. "Focus on your own home," Suniel replied.

111.title: European Commission Prez to arrive on 2-day visit to India from Apr 24
111.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen will arrive on a two-day visit to India from April 24, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said. She is scheduled to meet President Ram Nath Kovind and PM Narendra Modi during her first official visit.  She has been invited as the Chief Guest for this year's Raisina Dialogue, the MEA added.

112.title: Leopard that killed an 8-yr-old boy shot dead in U'khand's Tehri
112.article_body: A leopard, which killed an eight-year-old boy in Uttarakhand's Tehri district, was shot dead after it "returned to its kill site to devour the remaining body on Monday", a forest officer said. The boy was attacked while walking to a village to attend a wedding ceremony. Officials believe the leopard attacked humans as its damaged nails prevented it from hunting.

113.title: Heatwave pushes Delhi's power demand to 5,735 MW, highest ever in April
113.article_body: The peak power demand in Delhi on Tuesday rose to 5,735 MW, which is the highest ever in the month of April, after unabated heatwave in the city, discom officials said. Delhi's peak power demand had touched 4,469 MW on April 1. The national capital's previous high power demand was recorded at 5,664 MW on April 30, 2019, officials added.

114.title: Which are the world's most affordable and least affordable cities to buy home?
114.article_body: The US city of Pittsburgh is the most affordable city for buying a house, according to the Demographia International Housing Affordability's study on housing prices for 92 major markets (metropolitan areas). It's followed by Oklahoma City and Rochester in the US, Edmonton in Canada and St. Louis in the US. Hong Kong emerged as the least affordable city for housing.

115.title: 76 Ukrainan prisoners of war freed in swap with Russia: Deputy PM
115.article_body: Ukrainian Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk on Tuesday said that Russia handed over 60 soldiers, including 10 officers, and 16 civilians to Ukraine in an exchange for prisoners of war. "This was the fifth exchange of prisoners of war," she added. Separately, Russia began its offensive in eastern Ukraine after pulling its forces from the country's north.

116.title: New Zealand imposes new sanctions on Russian financial institutions
116.article_body: New Zealand Foreign Minister Nanaia Mahuta on Tuesday said the country is imposing new sanctions on Russian financial institutions such as eight of its largest banks over Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Mahuta said New Zealand is imposing sanctions on "18 financial entities, including Russia's central bank, sovereign wealth fund and the largest financial institutions in the country".

117.title: India will be one of the fastest growing economies by 2030: FM
117.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said India will be one of the fastest growing economies by 2030. Describing the Indian economy's recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic as "distinct" and "pronounced", Sitharaman said India undertook various structural reforms both before and after the pandemic. India converted the pandemic into an opportunity to further push these reforms, she added.

118.title: Japan's health ministry approves Novavax's COVID-19 vaccine
118.article_body: Japan's health ministry on Tuesday approved Novavax's COVID-19 vaccine as the fourth foreign-developed vaccine for use in the country. The ministry's experts panel endorsed the protein-based vaccine a day earlier. The Japanese government has agreed to purchase 150 million doses of Novavax's COVID-19 vaccine which is expected to be available for use by late May.

119.title: Germany probing displays of support for Russia's invasion of Ukraine
119.article_body: Police across several states in Germany on Monday reportedly opened over 140 investigations into public displays of support for Russia's invasion of Ukraine which began on February 24. Most investigations are looking into the use of the symbol 'Z' which has been associated with the invasion after being seen on many of the vehicles used by Russian troops in Ukraine.

120.title: Coach Toni Nadal doesn't want me to play like nephew Rafael: Auger-Aliassime
120.article_body: World number nine Felix Auger-Aliassime said his coach Toni Nadal, Rafael Nadal's uncle and former coach, isn't trying to make him play like his nephew. "We've been together for more than a year now working...things are going good...he (Toni) adapted to the player he's working with," he added. Auger-Aliassime will face Carlos Taberner in Barcelona Open second round on Wednesday.

121.title: Ajay Devgn & Tabu-starrer 'Bholaa' to release on March 30, 2023
121.article_body: Taking to Twitter, Ajay Devgn has announced that his upcoming film 'Bholaa' will release on March 30, 2023. The action-drama film is an official Hindi remake of the 2019 Tamil film 'Kaithi'. The film will also feature Tabu and will be directed by Dharmendra Sharma. Ajay Devgn Ffilms, T-Series Films, Reliance Entertainment and Dream Warrior Pictures will produce 'Bholaa'.

122.title: Former Congress councillor shot at in a local market in Punjab
122.article_body: A former municipal council member belonging to the Congress was shot at by unidentified assailants at a local market in Punjab's Ferozepur on Tuesday. According to the police, Congress leader Mulakh Raj was at the local market with his wife when some men arrived there in an SUV and fired at him before escaping.

123.title: Losing 'iconic' Monaco Grand Prix would be a 'shocker': Pierre Gasly
123.article_body: AlphaTauri's Pierre Gasly said losing the "iconic" Monaco Grand Prix would be a "shocker". "I think, and I really hope, we get to experience it as drivers because it's probably the toughest track of the season, the most challenging, and is my favourite one," Gasly said. The Monaco circuit has been a permanent fixture of the F1 calendar since 1955.

124.title: 2 cattle smugglers killed, 4 cops injured in 'militant ambush' in Assam
124.article_body: Two alleged cattle smugglers were killed and four police personnel were injured during a "militant ambush" in Assam's Kokrajhar district on Tuesday, police said. The pair were being taken to Jomduar area for smuggling routes' identification when their vehicle "came under firing from militants", an officer said. Police retaliated and the gunfire exchanges continued for 10-12 minutes, he added.

125.title: I actually wanted to quit tennis: 2019 US Open champion Andreescu
125.article_body: 2019 US Open champion Bianca Andreescu has revealed she "wanted to quit" tennis before taking a break from tennis earlier this year due to mental health concerns. "It was really bad. I'm privileged in a way for having this opportunity...doing all of this," she added. This week's Porsche Tennis Grand Prix is the 21-year-old's first tournament of the 2022 season.

126.title: WHO Centre is starting of traditional medicine era in world: PM Modi
126.article_body: Speaking at the inaugural ceremony of the WHO Global Centre for Traditional Medicine in Gujarat's Jamnagar, PM Narendra Modi said the centre has opened the door of age of traditional medicine in the world. PM Modi said, "It's not just an institution's inauguration, it is the beginning of the traditional medicine era in the world for the next 25 years."

127.title: Delhi sees 632 fresh COVID-19 cases, positivity rate drops to 4.42% from 7.72%
127.article_body: Delhi reported 632 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Tuesday, a day after it saw 501 cases. The daily positivity rate in the national capital was 4.42% as compared to 7.72% reported on Monday. The city saw zero deaths due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, while the active cases stood at 1,274.

128.title: Intense solar storm hits Earth, causes radio blackout in parts of Asia & Australia
128.article_body: An intense solar storm hit the Earth over the past weekend and caused radio blackouts in parts of Asia and Australia, US Space Weather Prediction Center said. As per the agency, the solar flare peaked late on Sunday (April 17) at 3.34 GMT (9.04 IST) and lasted around 34 minutes. It was followed by a massive Coronal Mass Ejection (CME).

129.title: No changes made: Google on claims it 'stopped hiding' Russian military facilities
129.article_body: Google has denied claims by many Google Maps users that it has 'stopped hiding' Russia's secret military facilities. Many users shared satellite pics of the facilities saying that they've been 'unblurred', giving anyone a view of the installations and command posts amid Russian invasion of Ukraine. "We haven't made any blurring changes to our satellite imagery in Russia," said Google.

130.title: Amazon, Reliance, Dream11 & Sony may compete for IPL broadcast rights: Report
130.article_body: Amazon, The Walt Disney Company and Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries are among the companies that have signalled an intention to bid for the rights to telecast IPL matches to be held between 2023 and 2027, Bloomberg reported. Sony, Zee and Dream11 also purchased the bid-related documents from BCCI, it added. BCCI will be conducting the online auction starting June 12.

131.title: Actor Ram Charan visits BSF camp in Amritsar, shares pics
131.article_body: Actor Ram Charan on Tuesday visited the Border Security Force (BSF) camp in Amritsar and shared a series of pictures on Instagram. He wrote, "Inspiring afternoon spent listening to stories, sacrifices & dedication of the Border Security Force at the BSF Campus, Khasa Amritsar." In the pictures, Ram can be seen greeting and eating with the soldiers.

132.title: BJP-ruled states should remove loudspeakers from mosques: Ex-VHP chief
132.article_body: Ex-Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) chief Pravin Togadia has said that BJP should remove loudspeakers from mosques in those states where it's in power. "We had demanded...removal of loudspeakers from mosques in Maharashtra some 10 years ago," he added. Togadia's comments come as Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray has demanded the removal of loudspeakers from mosques by May 3.

133.title: Proud to see Gujarat's success: PM Modi on Vidya Samiksha Kendra
133.article_body: While stressing on how children will be benefited from Gujarat’s Vidya Samiksha Kendra, PM Modi said, “The use of such a huge technology for our government primary school is a wonder for the world. It gives great pride to see the success and development of Gujarat.” He also said it can bring big changes in the field of education.

134.title: I found it cute: Srinidhi on Shehnaaz giving away spoiler of KGF 2
134.article_body: 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' actress Srinidhi Shetty, on being asked about Shehnaaz Gill giving away a major spoiler on Twitter, said she "really really found it quite cute". Srinidhi added she initially didn't believe Shehnaaz spoiled it and thought it was a fan page. Shehnaaz praised Srinidhi's performance, writing, "You deserve the compliments since you took a bullet for Rocky bhai."

135.title: Naxals set fire to 7 vehicles engaged in mining in Chhattisgarh
135.article_body: Naxals in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur allegedly burned down seven vehicles involved in sand mining. "There was sand mining going on in the Mingachal river, where six to seven vehicles were set on fire by several Naxals," P Sundarraj, IG Bastar, said. Four Hyva trucks, two JCBs were amongst the seven vehicles engaged in sand mining activities in the area.

136.title: 5 accused in Jahangirpuri violence charged under National Security Act
136.article_body: Five accused in Jahangirpuri violence have been charged under the stringent National Security Act, which allows detention for up to one year without any charge. Clashes broke out during a Hanuman Jayanti rally in North West Delhi's Jahangirpuri on Saturday. Police had said that stones were pelted and several vehicles were set ablaze during the clashes.

137.title: Which are India's 10 most valuable companies as HDFC drops out of the list?
137.article_body: Reliance Industries is India's most valuable company with a market value of ₹17.84 lakh crore, followed by TCS (₹12.71 lakh crore) and HDFC Bank (₹7.44 lakh crore). The list includes Infosys, ICICI Bank, Hindustan Unilever, SBI, Adani Green Energy and Bajaj Finance. Bharti Airtel is India's 10th most valuable company after HDFC Ltd dropped out of the list on Tuesday.

138.title: In talks with India to find solution on payments: Russian diplomat
138.article_body: Consul General of Russia in Mumbai AV Surovtsev said Russia is in talks with the Indian government and Reserve Bank of India to find a solution on the payments front. Due to its invasion of Ukraine, Russia has been cut off from the international payments system SWIFT. "Complicated situation" created by the sanctions creates room for Indian exports, Surovtsev added.

139.title: Sreenivasan discharged from hospital after cardiac arrest treatment
139.article_body: Malayalam actor Sreenivasan was discharged from Apollo Adlux Hospital in Kerala's Angamaly on Tuesday following bypass surgery as treatment for cardiac arrest. The 66-year-old was admitted to the hospital on March 30 after complaining of chest pain. A medical bulletin issued by the hospital stated that Sreenivasan is stable and showed remarkable improvement in his cardiac and general condition.

140.title: I am closest to Ishan Kishan in MI team: Suryakumar Yadav
140.article_body: On being asked to name his friends in MI, Suryakumar Yadav said he's "closest" to Ishan Kishan. "You've to have him around, whether you've won or lost...he can start up a conversation out of anything," he added. "We don't talk about cricket when we bat together," he further said. Suryakumar and Ishan are bottom-placed MI's top-two run-scorers in IPL 2022.

141.title: Formula One is in a good place commercially: Haas team boss Steiner
141.article_body: Haas team boss Gunther Steiner said Formula One is "in a good place commercially" following the addition of Las Vegas as a race venue from 2023 onwards. "In general, Formula One is in a good place commercially. There are a lot of places that want a race, we can almost choose where we want to go," Steiner said.

142.title: Man arrested for giving pistol to an accused in Jahangirpuri violence
142.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested a person named 'Gulli' for allegedly giving a pistol to an accused in the Jahangirpuri violence case. The police also arrested 28-year-old Imam alias Sonu, who was seen in a video purportedly firing a gun during the violence at Jahangirpuri. Drones are being used for surveillance in Delhi's Jahangirpuri after the violence, reports said.

143.title: Burning of Sri Lankan man's body by Pak mob anti-Islam: Court
143.article_body: An anti-terrorism court in Pakistan on Tuesday said that the lynching of a Sri Lankan man and the burning of his body by a mob was an act against Islam. "The Holy Prophet...forbade Muslims to disgrace the dead body of even a non-Muslim," it added. The court on Monday convicted 89 people in a mass trial over the crime.

144.title: Singapore & New Zealand to jointly tackle climate change: Leaders
144.article_body: Singapore and New Zealand will jointly tackle climate change by cooperating on green technologies, Prime Ministers from both countries, Lee Hsien Loong and Jacinda Ardern, said on Tuesday. The countries will adopt initiatives around energy transition technology, sustainable transport and waste management, Lee added. "We cannot...simply return to a high carbon emissions...approach," Ardern stated.

145.title: Kendrick Lamar announces new album after 5 years, Twitter users react
145.article_body: After a gap of five years, rapper Kendrick Lamar announced on Twitter that his new album 'Mr Morale & the Big Steppers' will release on May 13. He added the link oklama.com containing details of the album to an old tweet that read, "Lamar is officially retired." "IT'S HAPPENING," a Twitter user wrote. His last album 'DAMN' released in 2017.

146.title: Virat Kohli gets out for a golden duck, IPL share video of his reaction
146.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) batter Virat Kohli got out for a golden duck against Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in their IPL 2022 match on Tuesday. IPL shared a video of his dismissal. In the video, Kohli can be seen reacting to his dismissal with a dejected smile. It is Kohli's fourth golden duck in IPL.

147.title: Cryptocurrency Ponzi scheme busted in Bengaluru, 4 arrested
147.article_body: The Bengaluru Crime Branch arrested four people for their alleged involvement in running a Helium Crypto Token (HNT) through a mobile application. Around ₹15 crore was routed through 44 different bank accounts among other items, the police said. "₹78 lakh in cash, 44 Digital Signature Certificate tokens, five company seals, mobile phones, and laptops were seized," they added.

148.title: 23 people killed due to severe storms and lightning in Assam
148.article_body: At least 23 people were killed due to severe storms and lightning in separate incidents over the last few days in Assam and the state has promised compensation to the family of the deceased. "In the last three days, 22 districts reported [such] incidents in...over 1,591 villages, impacting [over] one lakh people," an official of state disaster management authority said.

149.title: Delhi Police under pressure from 'secular, Muslim' leaders: VHP
149.article_body: The Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) on Tuesday accused the Delhi Police of coming under pressure from "secular and Muslim leaders" to book the organisation in connection with the Jahangirpuri clashes. It also said that Delhi Commissioner of Police Rakesh Asthana's statement that it had not taken permission to take out the 'shobha yatra' through the area was "baseless".

150.title: People throw coins in theatre during 'KGF: Chapter 2' screening, Raveena shares video
150.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon on Tuesday took to social media to share a clip of people throwing coins in a theatre screening 'KGF: Chapter 2'. "After a long time seeing coins flying on to the screen! #flashingsilver!" she wrote in the caption. "It's a rage...Thank you for the love," Raveena's post further read.

151.title: I've become more expressive after 'Bigg Boss 15': Karan Kundrra
151.article_body: Karan Kundrra, speaking about life after 'Bigg Boss 15', has said that he has become more expressive. Karan added, "A lot has changed...I am not scared of talking because...I have an image." "Everybody thought that I am this arrogant, strict, angry person, like Roadies...Then people realise that he is not," he stated. Karan was the second runner-up in the show.

152.title: Expecting method acting in commercial films is dumb: Nawazuddin
152.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui in an interview has stated if you expect to use method acting in commercial films, then you are dumb. He further said that such films are for fun and the audience comes to enjoy. "If you...dissect my performances, maybe you'll find a lot of flaws. But if you take it as pure fun, one would...enjoy," Nawazuddin added.

153.title: Most important 3 points in your life: Klopp on match against Man Utd
153.article_body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said his players must treat the match against Manchester United on Tuesday like "it is the most important three points in your life". Liverpool trail Manchester City by one point in the Premier League with seven games left. "We have to be angry in a good way and all these kind of things," Klopp added.

154.title: BJP using riots as tool to win civic body polls in Delhi: Sanjay Raut
154.article_body: In an apparent reference to Jahangirpuri violence in Delhi, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said the BJP has to win elections through riots and do politics. Raut said, "Delhi is UT...The law-and-order is [being] taken care of by the Center...But since the last few days, there've been riots." "[Reason] behind this is the civic body polls," he added.

155.title: War-disabled soldiers must be treated with respect: Ex-VC of Army
155.article_body: Lieutenant General Vijay Oberoi (retd), former Vice-Chief of Army Staff, has demanded better treatment of war-disabled soldiers. He stated that they must be treated "with great respect and should be adequately compensated", otherwise as soldiers take a "conscious decision" to go to war, the future generation will think twice before risking their lives in service of the nation.

156.title: Finland's President Sauli Niinistö tests positive for COVID-19
156.article_body: Finland's President Sauli Niinistö has tested positive for COVID-19, his office said in a statement on Tuesday. "Despite the infection, President Niinistö is well and continuing to work remotely," it added. Niinistö's official visit to Norway to discuss the conflict in Ukraine and European security from April 21 to 22 has been postponed.

157.title: Thief dances after robbing hardware store in UP, CCTV footage goes viral
157.article_body: A person robbing a hardware store in UP's Chandauli was caught dancing after committing the crime. CCTV footage of the incident that took place on Friday night has gone viral online. It shows the thief's face covered with a white cloth and he's seen dancing while facing the CCTV camera before escaping through the store's shutter.

158.title: That feels very proud too: Madhavan on being called Vedaant's father
158.article_body: Actor R Madhavan on Tuesday responded to writer Anand Ranganathan's tweet about his upcoming film 'Rocketry' referring to him as Vedaant Madhavan's father. The actor wrote, "Somehow that felt very proud too. Thank you chief." Vedaant won gold medal in the men's 800m freestyle event and silver medal in the 1500m freestyle swimming event at the Danish Open in Copenhagen.

159.title: Punjab women's college management suspended over ₹11 cr funds misuse
159.article_body: The management of Punjab's Akal Degree College for Women has been placed under suspension by the state government over the alleged misuse of funds amounting to ₹11.86 crore. A probe by the state higher education department reportedly found that the managing committee of the Sangrur college had transferred the amount to another college and used it to start self-finance courses.

160.title: 6 killed as SUV and bus collide in UP's Deoria
160.article_body: Six people were killed and 12 were injured after an SUV collided with a bus in Deoria, Uttar Pradesh. The accident took place when the occupants of the SUV were returning from a marriage function, the police said. Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath expressed grief over the incident and directed officials to provide proper treatment to the injured.

161.title: TRS leader's son held for kidnaping, raping 20-yr-old after drugging her in T'gana
161.article_body: TRS ward councillor Mohammed Khaja's son Sheik Ghouse Pasha and his friend have been arrested for allegedly kidnapping and gang-raping a 20-year-old woman for two days after drugging her in Telangana's Kodad. The woman alleged when she regained consciousness, she escaped and informed her family about the incident. She added she was beaten up so badly that she was unconscious.

162.title: Nani marks 3yrs of National Award-winning 'Jersey', shares deleted scene
162.article_body: Telugu actor Nani on Tuesday celebrated three years since the release of his National Award-winning film 'Jersey' by sharing a deleted scene from the film. The actor wrote, "This was one of (director) Gowtam Tinnanuri's favourite but couldn't make it to the cut." The scene depicts Nani's character being offered money by his wife's father and being called a loser.

163.title: If things are wrong, they shouldn't be sold: Ajay on criticism over endorsements
163.article_body: Ajay Devgn, speaking about criticism over endorsements, said if certain things are so wrong, they shouldn't be sold. "It's a personal choice. When you do something, you also see how harmful it would be. Some things are harmful, some aren't," he added. Earlier, Akshay Kumar was criticised for joining Ajay and Shah Rukh Khan in endorsing a pan masala brand.

164.title: Probe ordered against Assam CM Sarma ahead of Guwahati civic polls
164.article_body: Assam State Election Commission has instructed to initiate a probe against Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma for alleged model code violations during campaigns for Guwahati civic polls. A complaint was filed by Asom Jatiya Parishad (AJP) president Sanjeev Bora against Sarma, accusing him of promising 'land patta' to landless residents. The complaint further alleged that Sarma sought to bribe wards.

165.title: IMF cuts India's GDP growth forecast sharply from 9% to 8.2% for FY23
165.article_body: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has sharply cut India's GDP growth forecast for FY23 to 8.2% from 9%, citing Russia-Ukraine war. "Economic damage from the conflict will contribute to a significant slowdown in global growth in 2022 and add to inflation," the IMF said in its World Economic Outlook report. IMF cut its global growth outlook for 2022 to 3.6%.

166.title: LSG to bowl first against RCB in their IPL 2022 clash, both sides unchanged
166.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) captain KL Rahul won the toss and elected to bowl first against Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) in their IPL 2022 clash on Tuesday. Both the teams are fielding the same playing XIs they fielded in their previous respective matches. LSG are currently third on the points table, while RCB are fourth.

167.title: 1 killed & 10 injured as Sri Lankan police fire at anti-govt protesters
167.article_body: At least one person was killed and around 10 people were injured after police fired at anti-government protesters in Sri Lanka's Rambukkana, reports said on Tuesday. As per reports, police said that protesters had attempted to set fire to a fuel bowser. Sri Lanka has seen widespread protests amid the worst economic crisis the country has seen since independence.

168.title: Dhawan is in form of his life, he's 'Mr IPL' for me: Swann
168.article_body: Calling Shikhar Dhawan "Mr IPL", Graeme Swann said the PBKS opener is in the form of his life. "I love watching every minute of him bat like that," he added. "He's been playing a pink suit gear dog in...[ongoing] IPL," he further said. Shikhar is PBKS' second-highest run-scorer, having scored 205 runs thus far this season in six matches.

169.title: Russia seeks medical equipment from India amid war
169.article_body: Russia is seeking more medical equipment from India after several countries imposed sanctions on Russia after its decision to invade Ukraine, according to Bloomberg. Indian and Russian firms will discuss ways to increase supplies during a meeting on April 22, Rajiv Nath, the Association of Indian Medical Device Industry's coordinator said.

170.title: Main accused in Jahangirpuri violence a BJP leader: AAP MLA Atishi
170.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party MLA Atishi on Tuesday alleged that the main accused in Jahangirpuri violence, Ansar, is a BJP leader. "It is clear that the BJP is behind the Jahangirpuri riots and it should apologise to the people of Delhi. BJP is a party of hooligans," AAP's Atishi said in a tweet.

171.title: Auditioned for 'X-Factor' as I wanted to marry Harry Styles: Camila
171.article_body: Singer Camila Cabello has revealed she auditioned for reality show 'X-Factor' because she wanted to marry singer Harry Styles. "This is really embarrassing and I can only say this because it's like 10 years ago...I really believed that at the time," she added. Camila further said she thought they'll meet, she'll become a singer and they'll probably fall in love.

172.title: I hate Shang-Chi comics, character is not fleshed out: Simu Liu
172.article_body: Actor Simu Liu has revealed that he hates certain Shang-Chi comics due to the way the stories involving the Chinese-American superhero were written. Simu added that the comics were written by white men who didn't understand an authentic Asian-American experience. "[Shang-Chi in the comics] was very serious, spoke mostly in mystical proverbs and didn't feel fleshed out," the actor said.

173.title: He'll become unplayable bowler, play for India: Gavaskar on SRH pacer Umran
173.article_body: Seeing SRH pacer Umran Malik's bowling performance in ongoing IPL, Sunil Gavaskar said the 22-year-old is going to play for India soon. He added that Umran's accuracy has been more impressive than his speed. "If he bowls wicket-to-wicket, he's pretty much going to become an unplayable bowler," he further said. Umran has taken nine wickets from six matches so far.

174.title: HC grants interim relief to Khadse's wife in Pune land scam case
174.article_body: The Bombay High Court has granted interim relief to senior Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader Eknath Khadse's wife Mandakini Eknath Khadse in the Pune land scam case. The next hearing will take place on April 25, Mandakini's advocate Mohan Tekavde said. The case is related to the alleged money laundering pertaining to a land at Bhosari in Pune.

175.title: No one is indispensable: Cong MP Bordoloi on Ripun Bora joining TMC
175.article_body: Congress MP Pradyut Bordoloi reacted to ex-Assam party unit chief Ripun Bora's recent switchover to Trinamool Congress (TMC), terming the move "unfortunate", adding that "nobody is indispensable". Bordoloi added that the Congress "has very strong DNA" in Assam and wasn't dependent on Bora's support. Bora has said that only the TMC is capable of fighting against BJP.
