176.title: Once heard an actress' mom say 'Be nice, he's big producer': Poonam
176.article_body: Actress Poonam Dhillon has revealed she once heard the mother of an actress tell her to be nice to a man because he is a big producer. "You have to be nice to everyone, your driver, make-up artist, producer, director...If a parent pressures the daughter to be 'nice' to a producer, obviously you're asking her to compromise," Poonam added.

177.title: Delhi's COVID-19 positivity rate jumped 3-fold between April 11-18
177.article_body: The COVID-19 positivity rate in Delhi registered a nearly three-fold rise between April 11 and 18, according to data released by Delhi's health department. While the positivity rate stood at 2.7% on April 11, it jumped to 7.72% on April 18. Last week, Delhi recorded 2,606 COVID-19 positive cases against 67,360 tests with an average positivity rate of 4.79%.

178.title: Kajal Aggarwal and Gautam Kitchlu blessed with a baby boy
178.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal and her husband Gautam Kitchlu welcomed a baby boy on Tuesday morning, Kajal's sister Nisha Aggarwal told Indian Express. She also shared that both the mother and the baby are doing well and are healthy. Kajal and Gautam got married in October 2020 and Gautam had announced earlier this year that they are set to become parents.

179.title: Pic shows bags full of cats & dogs in China as police kill pets of COVID +ve owners
179.article_body: Pictures and videos of bags full of cats and dogs on a pavement in China's Shanghai amid COVID-19 lockdown are being widely circulated online. Police in the city are allegedly torturing and killing the pets of owners who have tested positive for COVID-19. Earlier, a video showing a health worker beating a pet dog to death also surfaced online.

180.title: I used to be insomniac, now I'm early morning person: Shahid Kapoor
180.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor, speaking about his sleeping habits, said that he wakes up early. Shahid further stated that if he has a shoot at 8-9 am, he wakes up 3.5 hours before it. "I used to be an insomniac. Now I'm a very early morning person...I love morning energy and by 6-6.30 in the evening I am out," Shahid added.

181.title: Mumbai to soon become India's first city to get a 100% digital bus
181.article_body: Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) on Tuesday released a video on its Twitter handle showing the demo of India's first fully digital bus. For boarding and de-boarding, passengers can either flash their smartcards in front of a machine fixed at the bus' rear entrance or use the 'Chalo' mobile app. The fare will automatically be deducted when de-boarding.

182.title: Boy addicted to games kills self as father fails to recharge internet in MP
182.article_body: A 14-year-old boy allegedly hanged himself from the ceiling fan of his home after his father, who works as a labourer, was unable to recharge his mobile internet in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur. Police said the man was facing financial problems. The boy was addicted to playing games on the mobile phone, City Superintendent of Police (CSP) Alok Sharma said.

183.title: Bhushan Kumar's attempts show his thirst to get rid of rape case: Mumbai court
183.article_body: A Mumbai magistrate's court said producer Bhushan Kumar, who was accused in a rape case, has "no locus standi to address...court but he has attempted to contest the matter which is...unethical". "His attempts show his...thirst to get rid of the matter," the court said. It rejected police's closure report and directed them to probe the matter as per law.

184.title: Reliance Brands acquires 51% majority stake in Abu Jani Sandeep Khosla
184.article_body: Reliance Brands Limited (RBL) has acquired a majority stake in luxury fashion label Abu Jani Sandeep Khosla. RBL has signed a definitive agreement to invest in the prominent couture brand for a 51% stake. The company has recently set up a ready-to-wear fashion venture with Delhi-based designer Rahul Mishra and also acquired a 40% stake in Manish Malhotra.

185.title: Nani was outstanding in 'Jersey', I cried watching him in it: Shahid
185.article_body: Shahid Kapoor has revealed that he cried watching actor Nani's performance in the 2019 Telugu film 'Jersey'. "Nani was outstanding in the film. He is younger, so for him to have played the father was, kudos to him for pulling it off," he stated. Shahid will star in the Hindi remake of the film which will release on April 22.

186.title: Barcelona suffer 0-1 loss to relegation-threatened Cadiz in La Liga
186.article_body: Barcelona on Monday suffered a shock 0-1 defeat at home to relegation-threatened Cadiz in La Liga. Barcelona are now 15 points behind leaders Real Madrid. "It's a very bad week for us  and we need to change the dynamic as soon as possible," manager Xavi said. Barcelona exited the UEFA Europa League after losing to Eintracht Frankfurt last week.

187.title: Man rapes, blackmails woman by using obscene videos in Gurugram
187.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly raping and blackmailing a 30-year-old woman by using her objectionable videos in Gurugram, police said on Tuesday. The accused made a video of the woman bathing some time back and used it to threaten and rape her on different occasions, police said. The survivor informed her sister after which a case was registered.

188.title: Sri Lankan Prez admits mistakes led to severe economic crisis
188.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Monday said he made mistakes that led to the severe economic crisis in the country and pledged to correct them. "Today, people are under immense pressure due to this economic crisis. I deeply regret this situation," he added. Rajapaksa made the remarks while speaking to the new Cabinet ministers appointed by him.

189.title: Lithuania bans usage of letter 'Z' amid Russian invasion of Ukraine
189.article_body: Lithuania on Tuesday banned the public displays of the letter 'Z' and other signs that symbolise support for Russia amid Ukraine's invasion. The letter 'Z' has been used as a marking on Russian military equipment participating in the war. Lithuanian lawmakers have also reportedly approved that fines for breaching the ban should be raised to €900 for individuals (over ₹74,000).

190.title: 10 dead, 8 injured in road crash in Rajasthan, CM expresses grief
190.article_body: Ten members of a family were killed after the jeep they were travelling in crashed with a parked tractor trolley in Rajasthan's Jhunjhunu district on Tuesday. Eight others were also injured in the crash which took place on the Jhunjhunu-Gudha Godji highway in the afternoon, police said. CM Ashok Gehlot has expressed his deepest condolences over the incident.

191.title: Adi Chopra said before debut 'You're not Hrithik, do acting': Ranveer
191.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has revealed that filmmaker Aditya Chopra told him before his debut, "You're not Hrithik Roshan, toh tu acting kar lena (so you do acting)." The actor added that he once saw two people standing in front of his debut film 'Band Baaja Baaraat' poster. "They said, 'Who is this? He doesn't look like a hero!'" Ranveer said.

192.title: Man Utd’s Bruno Fernandes uninjured after being involved in car crash
192.article_body: Manchester United's Bruno Fernandes on Monday escaped uninjured after being involved in a car crash. All parties involved in the crash escaped without any serious injuries. The Portuguese midfielder was able to train ahead of Manchester United's match with Liverpool in the Premier League on Tuesday. "He was okay and he'll be okay for tomorrow," interim manager Ralf Rangnick said.

193.title: It’s not rocket science: Man Utd boss Rangnick on transfer windows
193.article_body: Manchester United's interim boss Ralf Rangnick on Monday said the club needs a couple of transfer windows to rebuild success, adding that getting it right is "not rocket science". "If you know what you are looking for it will take two or three transfer windows," he said. "It's not that complicated, it's not rocket science," he added.

194.title: Jahangirpuri violence effort to tarnish image of country, PM: BJP MP
194.article_body: BJP MP from North West Delhi Hans Raj Hans said that the Jahangirpuri violence was an effort to tarnish the image of the country and PM Narendra Modi before Boris Johnson's visit. "The Prime Minister is continuously trying to make India the number one country in the world. He has become an international personality," he said.

195.title: No need to panic for now: Sisodia amid rising COVID-19 cases in Delhi
195.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Tuesday said that there is no need to panic for now, adding that "we'll have to learn to live with COVID-19 as it'll stay in some capacity". Sisodia added the Delhi government will take strict action if COVID-19 cases increase more. DDMA will hold a meeting tomorrow over the same.

196.title: 3 killed in Arunachal Pradesh after heavy rains trigger landslide
196.article_body: Three persons, including a nine-year-old child, were killed in Arunachal Pradesh's Kurung Kumey district after heavy rains caused a massive landslide. The victims were buried alive in Monday's incident which also damaged at least 15 houses, an official said. The state has been receiving continuous rainfall for over a week causing road connectivity to be disrupted in several areas.

197.title: 22-yr-old BTech student found dead in his house in J'khand, probe on
197.article_body: A third-year BTech student was found dead in his house in Jharkhand's Ranchi on Monday. Police believe that the deceased, Vijay Mahto, died by suicide over an affair. However, his parents have reportedly claimed the 22-year-old was dumped on the roof after being beaten to death and have also named some people they suspect. Police are investigating the allegations.

198.title: HDFC no longer among India's top 10 most valuable companies
198.article_body: India's largest housing finance company HDFC Ltd is no longer among the top 10 most valuable companies of India in terms of market capitalisation. The shares of HDFC have plunged nearly 19% after the announcement of its merger with HDFC Bank earlier this month. Meanwhile, HDFC Bank is the third most valuable company of India after Reliance Industries and TCS.

199.title: Tactically he never had it: Boycott on Root's Test captaincy
199.article_body: Ex-England cricketer Geoffrey Boycott said Joe Root never had the tactical ability to be England's Test skipper. He added Root didn't have the instinct for changing situations in the match. "Captaincy is tactical awareness and man management of players," he further said. Root led England in 64 Tests, won 27 and lost 26, both a record for an English captain.

200.title: Delhi govt should take over Rohini ashram housing women improperly: HC
200.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday said the Delhi government's health department should take over the Adhyatmik Vidyalaya, an ashram in Rohini, housing women in "animal-like conditions". "We find it difficult to accept that the inmates of the institution are in their full senses and that they are [there] of their own free will," the HC said.

201.title: Man arrested for allegedly raping his 14-year-old daughter in Delhi
201.article_body: A 45-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly raping his 14-year-old daughter in Delhi, police said on Tuesday. According to Superintendent of Police Hemraj Meena, the man allegedly raped his daughter at their house. The girl's brother filed a complaint against the accused, following which the police arrested the man, the police officer added.

202.title: Fire breaks out at powerhouse in Ghaziabad; fire tenders rushed to spot
202.article_body: A fire broke out at Niti Khand Indirapuram's powerhouse on Tuesday. Ghaziabad Police informed that local police, fire department are on the spot and efforts are on to bring the fire under control. In another incident, a fire broke out at a shop in West Delhi's Kirti Nagar furniture market on Tuesday, ANI reported, citing Delhi Fire Service officials.

203.title: Not guaranteed that Macron will win French presidential polls: PM
203.article_body: France PM Jean Castex said on Tuesday that Emmanuel Macron wasn't guaranteed to win the runoff in the presidential election on April 24 against his political opponent Marine Le Pen. Macron and Le Pen secured the most votes in the first round of elections. Notably, Castex has also said that he'll tender his resignation if Macron is re-elected as President.

204.title: 22-yr-old woman slashes fiancé's throat after calling him for 'surprise date' in Andhra
204.article_body: A 22-year-old woman in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam allegedly slashed her fiancé's throat a month ahead of their marriage after calling him for a 'surprise date'. The man, who is a scientist with the Council of Scientific & Industrial Research, has been hospitalised. Police said the woman confessed to the crime, adding that she was being forced to marry him.

205.title: Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif's 37-member Cabinet sworn in
205.article_body: The 37-member Cabinet of newly-elected Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif took oath during a brief ceremony on Tuesday. The new Cabinet includes members of political parties allied with Sharif's PML-N. Senate Chairman Sadiq Sanjrani had administered the oath after President Arif Alvi, an ally of ex-PM Imran Khan, excused himself reportedly citing his health.

206.title: Max temperature in Hyderabad likely to touch 40°C in next 2 days: IMD
206.article_body: India Meteorological Department has predicted that the maximum temperature in Hyderabad is likely to touch 40 degrees Celsius in the next two days. However, the weather department has also predicted a partly cloudy sky with the possibility of rain or thunderstorm in the city. According to the IMD, the city reported a maximum temperature of 39 degrees Celsius on Monday.

207.title: Hyd's Bahadurpura flyover opens for public; to ease traffic congestion
207.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao and Mohammed Mahmood Ali inaugurated the six-lane bi-directional flyover at Bahadurpura in Hyderabad on Tuesday. The flyover from Bahadurpura Police Station to Nehru Zoological Park, which has been constructed at an estimated cost of ₹69 crore, is expected to ease traffic congestion in the area. Hyderabad MP Asaduddin Owaisi was also present during the inauguration.

208.title: Japan fast food chain fires MD for saying 'get virgins' addicted to their food
208.article_body: Japan's fast-food chain Yoshinoya, known for its inexpensive bowls of beef on rice, has fired its managing director over his alleged derogatory remarks toward women. Masaki Ito during a university lecture apparently said that the company should try to "get virgins addicted" to Yoshinoya’s food because "once men treat them to expensive meals they won't eat beef bowls anymore".

209.title: Villagers stage protest against toll plaza in Gurugram
209.article_body: Residents of villages along the Sohna road on Monday protested at the Ghamroj toll plaza in Gurugram, demanding an exemption from paying the toll tax. The protesters also threatened to raze toll plaza if the toll is not made free for locals by Wednesday. A resident said, "(Nitin) Gadkari...said that nearby residents will get free passes but we're being charged."

210.title: 'Kem cho? Majama?', says WHO chief as PM Modi applauds; video surfaces
210.article_body: A video has shown WHO Director-General Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus talking in Gujarati during an event in Jamnagar. The video shows Ghebreyesus saying, "Kem cho? Majama? (How are you? Fine?)", while PM Narendra Modi is seen laughing and applauding. He was speaking at the inaugural ceremony of the WHO-Global Centre for Traditional Medicine.

211.title: Didn't do rom-coms for 20 yrs, scripts weren't good: Julia Roberts
211.article_body: Actress Julia Roberts has revealed that she has not done romantic-comedy films in the last 20 years because there wasn't a single good script. "If I'd read something that...was that 'Notting Hill'...or 'My Best Friend's Wedding' level...I would do it," she added. Julia further said that she has three children and has to work with her husband and children's schedules.

212.title: Gambhir said 'Look at your initials': Suryakumar Yadav on how he got nickname 'SKY'
212.article_body: Talking about how he got nickname 'SKY', batter Suryakumar Yadav revealed that when he was with KKR in 2014, Gautam Gambhir started calling him 'SKY' but he didn't pay attention. "Gambhir said, 'I am calling you only. Check your initials.' Then I realised it's 'SKY'," Suryakumar said. Suryakumar played for KKR from 2014 to 2017.

213.title: President gives assent to Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill
213.article_body: President of India Ram Nath Kovind has given his assent to the Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill, which allows police to obtain physical and biological samples of convicts and those accused of crimes. Moreover, it also empowers a magistrate to order measurements or photographs of a person to be taken to aid the investigation of an offence.

214.title: Your pain is our pain: Manchester United to Ronaldo after his newborn son passes away
214.article_body: After Cristiano Ronaldo announced the death of his newborn son, Manchester United tweeted, "Your pain is our pain." The club further said in a statement, "Family is more important than everything and Ronaldo is supporting his loved ones at this immensely difficult time...We can confirm he will not feature in the match against Liverpool at Anfield on Tuesday evening."

215.title: PM inaugurates new dairy complex, potato processing plant in Gujarat
215.article_body: PM Narendra Modi today inaugurated a new dairy complex and a potato processing plant, which is built at a cost of over ₹600 crore, at Banas Dairy in Gujarat's Banaskantha district. "Initiatives at Banas Dairy will empower farmers and boost...rural economy," PM tweeted. The dairy complex will enable the processing of about 30 lakh litres of milk daily, PMO stated.

216.title: 'KGF 2' collects ₹600 cr globally, becomes 9th highest-grossing Indian film
216.article_body: 'KGF: Chapter 2' has collected over ₹600 crore globally within five days of its release and has become the ninth highest-grossing Indian film of all time, as per film trade analyst Manobala Vijayabalan. According to film trade analyst Taran Adarsh, the Hindi-dubbed version of the Yash-starrer has earned over ₹200 crore domestically. The film is directed by Prashanth Neel.

217.title: Govt revising all testing norms for EV batteries & cells: Reports
217.article_body: The government is revising all testing norms for batteries, battery management and cells after multiple EV scooters caught fire across India, CNBC-TV18 reported. The government is holding a dialogue with companies connected with the fire incidents. Okinawa, Ola, Jitendra Electric and Pure EV are being advised on steps that need to be taken to prevent such fires in future.

218.title: UP govt allots land, houses to 63 Hindu families displaced from Bangladesh
218.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government on Tuesday allotted houses, agricultural land and residential plots to 63 Hindu families, displaced from East Pakistan, now called Bangladesh, in the 1970s. A total of 65 families were to be given rehabilitation after the yarn mill they were working in was closed in 1984. "Your 38-year-long wait is over today," CM Yogi Adityanath said.

219.title: 2 men try to drive into Mauritius PM's convoy in Mumbai; arrested
219.article_body: Two men, who were allegedly drunk, tried to drive into the convoy of Mauritius PM Pravind Kumar Jugnauth in Mumbai's Mahim Causeway in the early hours of Monday. Police said the men appeared drunk but their medical report is yet to come. The convoy was moving from the Western Expressway Highway towards Bandra Worli sea link.

220.title: Centre procures 69 lakh metric tonnes of wheat in current season
220.article_body: The Centre has procured 69.24 lakh metric tonnes (LMT) of wheat, with an MSP value of ₹13,951 crore, till April 17 during the rabi marketing season (RMS) 2022-23, Union Ministry's officials said. According to them, the wheat procurement has benefitted nearly 5.86 lakh farmers this season. The MSP of wheat for the RMS 2022-23 is ₹2,015 per quintal.

221.title: Cyberspace threats directly impact India's national security: Doval
221.article_body: NSA Ajit Doval said cyberspace threats directly impact India's social, economic and national security. A digital revolution is taking place across India, Doval said while speaking at a cybersecurity training workshop's inauguration. Also present at the event, National Cybersecurity Coordinator Lt Gen Rajesh Pant said, "The [Centre] is taking various steps to build capacities...in cybersecurity."

222.title: Ready to take in at least 10,000 injured Ukrainian soldiers: Poland
222.article_body: Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki said Poland is ready to take in and treat at least 10,000 injured Ukrainian soldiers. Poland is already treating "several dozen" soldiers, Morawiecki said during a visit to Ukraine's Lviv city. Last week, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said up to 3,000 Ukrainian troops have died and 10,000 soldiers have been injured in the war so far.

223.title: Indian economy not immune to Ukraine war, inflation on the cards: RBI
223.article_body: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) said as the Russia-Ukraine war continues to affect the global supply chain and inflate prices, the Indian economy is expected to not remain immune either. India's high inflation and widening trade deficit are expected to hamper growth and lead to "rocketing inflation", RBI added. Retail inflation rose to a 17-month high of 6.95% in March.

224.title: Gorilla addicted to smartphones has his screen time cut down in US zoo
224.article_body: A 16-year-old gorilla, who developed a smartphone addiction after being shown pictures and videos by visitors at a US zoo, is having his screen time cut down. Amare, due to his addiction, had reportedly failed to notice as another gorilla had charged at him. Zoo authorities have now put up a rope to keep visitors away from his enclosure.

225.title: Drew references from my mom for 'Jersey' role: Mrunal Thakur
225.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur has revealed that she plays a mother in Shahid Kapoor-starrer upcoming film 'Jersey', adding that it is something she hasn't really experienced in real life. "So I drew references from my mother for the part," the actress said. Mrunal further said that she has waited for the film to hit the big screen for a long time.

226.title: I didn't see a screenplay in 'Beast': Vijay's father SA Chandrasekhar
226.article_body: Talking about his son and actor Vijay's film 'Beast', director SA Chandrasekhar said he couldn't see a screenplay in the movie, adding that the film was made "solely" on Vijay's stardom. "The magic is there in the screenplay. You can't lightly handle a very heavy subject which is about international terrorist organisations. The director has to...study it," added Chandrasekhar.

227.title: SC reconstitutes monitoring committee in Delhi-Doon corridor project
227.article_body: The expert committee to monitor the compensatory afforestation in the Delhi-Dehradun Economic corridor project was reconstituted by the Supreme Court on Tuesday. The bench directed that the chairperson of the committee will be the Director-General Forests, Ministry of Environment, Forests and Climate Change. Notably, the project will reduce the travel time between Delhi and Dehradun to 2.5 hours.

228.title: CoBRA commando injured in encounter with Naxals in Chhattisgarh
228.article_body: A commando of CRPF's CoBRA unit was injured in an encounter with Naxals in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district on Tuesday. The gunfight took place in the forest between Kottaguda and Pegdapalli villages, where joint teams of security forces were on a search operation, IGP Sundarraj P said. The injured commando, identified as Sanjeev Kumar, is currently being treated.

229.title: Jahangirpuri violence a criminal conspiracy: Police in report to MHA
229.article_body: The Delhi Police on Tuesday submitted the preliminary report to Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) into the Jahangirpuri violence that took place during a Hanuman Jayanti rally on Saturday. Police said the violence was a part of criminal conspiracy. In the report, the police mentioned immediate steps taken by the forces to control the situation.

230.title: Since April 15, life has been about baby crying, no sleep: Mohena on son's birth
230.article_body: 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai' actress Mohena Kumari took to Instagram to share post after the birth of her son on April 15. "These last few days have gone by so fast...Since the 15th of April...life has been all about...hospital bed, baby nurses...baby feeding, baby crying...baby pacifying, no sleep, medicines and of course recovery," she wrote.

231.title: I ran away from home to pursue acting: 'Arjun Reddy' actress Shalini
231.article_body: Actress Shalini Pandey, who made her acting debut with Telugu film 'Arjun Reddy' said she ran away from home to pursue acting. "Dad wasn't convinced to let me [become an actress]. I was trying to convince him for four years but he wasn't letting me pursue it," added Shalini. Shalini will be seen in the upcoming Ranveer Singh-starrer 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar'.

232.title: Leaked pictures of Prabhas from 'Salaar' sets surface online
232.article_body: Two pictures of actor Prabhas from the sets of his upcoming film 'Salaar' have been leaked online. The film is directed and written by Prashanth Neel, who has directed the 'KGF' franchise. Actress Shruti Haasan is the female lead in the film and actor Prithviraj will also feature in the film. The film's release date is yet to be announced.

233.title: Growing stronger: Tahira shares a video lifting heavy weights after 3.5 yrs
233.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana's wife, author Tahira Kashyap Khurrana shared a glimpse of her workout video. Her latest video shows her regaining her strength and lifting heavy weights after three and a half years. Sharing the video, Tahira wrote, "Growing stronger! Being able to lift this much after 3.5 years." Taking to the comments section, actress Shilpa Shetty commented, "Daaanggg."

234.title: SRK to work with Rajkumar Hirani for first time, announces film 'Dunki'
234.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan took to Twitter to announce his new film 'Dunki' with filmmaker Rajkumar Hirani. "Dear @RajkumarHirani sir, you turned out to be my Santa Claus...you start [film], I'll reach on time...actually I will start living on the set...Feeling humbled & excited to finally work with you...Bringing to you all #Dunki...in cinemas on 22nd December 2023," he wrote.

235.title: Hijab won't be allowed during K'taka II PUC exams: Education Minister
235.article_body: Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh said that hijabs won't be allowed during the II Pre-University Course Examination. "All students must follow rules on uniform, hijab cladding students won't be allowed," he said. The row over hijab began in December 2021, when six female students of Government PU College for Girls in Udupi were not allowed to attend classes wearing headscarves.

236.title: Karthik can be used as a finisher in the upcoming T20 WC: Gavaskar
236.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said that RCB batter Dinesh Karthik can play the finisher's role for India in this year's T20 World Cup. "He's (Karthik) just changing the complexion of the game with his performance. He's doing the job that you can expect him to do at number 6 or 7 at the (T20) World Cup," Gavaskar said.

237.title: 'Feeling good,' says McCoy after bowling a match-winning final over vs KKR
237.article_body: Rajasthan Royals pacer Obed McCoy said that he "felt good" after the match against KKR in which the West Indian defended 11 runs in the final over and led RR to a victory. "This is my first game since last year...had come under pressure, feeling good, it was just about getting over the nerves and going hard," McCoy said.

238.title: Philippines envoy to China dies aged 74 while in quarantine
238.article_body: The Philippines' Ambassador to China, Jose Santiago "Chito" Sta. Romana, has died aged 74 while he was reportedly in 21-day quarantine in Huangshan city after returning from the Philippines. The Philippine Foreign Affairs Department condoled his death and said the Philippines and China's ties "flourished despite differences" under Sta. Romana's tenure. He was appointed as envoy to China in 2016.

239.title: Auto, taxi drivers call off strike demanding hike in fares in Delhi
239.article_body: Unions representing autorickshaws and taxis have called off strike demanding a hike in fares in Delhi. "If no action is taken in 25 days, then after 25 days we will shut Delhi's total food chain including tempos and trucks," an official said. Autorickshaw and taxi drivers have been demanding a cut in CNG prices and a hike in fares.

240.title: Arjun, Bhumi begin shooting for 'The Ladykiller' in Himachal Pradesh
240.article_body: Arjun Kapoor and Bhumi Pednekar have started shooting for filmmaker Ajay Bahl's next movie, 'The Ladykiller', in Himachal Pradesh. Arjun, while speaking about the forthcoming project, said, "The Ladykiller is one of the most exciting scripts of my career." "I'm thrilled to be collaborating with Bhumi and my director Ajay Bahl for the first time," he added.

241.title: Chiranjeevi reaches for the last rites of producer Narayan Das Narang in Hyderabad
241.article_body: Chiranjeevi reached for the funeral of producer Narayan Das Narang. The actor will pay his respects at the last rites which will reportedly begin in the afternoon. Several celebrities from Tollywood will attend the funeral in Hyderabad. Chiranjeevi also paid tribute to the late producer on Twitter and said he created a niche for himself with his expertise.

242.title: Trying to convince EU to restrict Russian oil supplies: France
242.article_body: France has said that it is trying to convince the members of the European Union (EU) to restrict oil supplies from Russia in view of the Ukraine war. "In light of what is happening now in Donbas, the stoppage of oil supplies from Russia is necessary more than ever," said French minister Bruno Le Maire.

243.title: I said, 'If I perform, everything will fall into place': Suryakumar on IPL 2020 match vs RCB
243.article_body: Recalling his unbeaten 79-run innings against RCB in IPL 2020, MI batter Suryakumar Yadav said he was disappointed prior to the match as he wasn't picked in India squad. "When I went in to bat, the target was in front of me. I said to myself, 'If I perform here, everything else will fall into place'," he added.

244.title: Gang of car thieves busted in Ferozepur, 2 members arrested
244.article_body: A gang of car thieves was busted in Ferozepur with the arrest of two of its members and the recovery of two stolen cars and a firearm. "Following a tip-off, the police team intercepted the accused in a car and recovered a .32-bore weapon along with two of its magazines and 10 cartridges," Ferozepur SSP, Charanjit Singh, said.

245.title: HFDC no longer among India's top 10 most valuable companies
245.article_body: India's largest housing finance company HDFC Ltd is no longer among the top 10 most valuable companies of India in terms of market capitalisation. The shares of HDFC have plunged nearly 19% after the announcement of its merger with HDFC Bank earlier this month. Meanwhile, HDFC Bank is the third most valuable company of India after Reliance Industries and TCS.

246.title: Lost teeth on stage, it's going to be lifetime memory for me: Hunarbaaz winner
246.article_body: Akash Singh, who won the reality show 'Hunarbaaz: Desh Ki Shaan' on Sunday, has revealed that he fell off a pole and broke three teeth while preparing for his act on stage. "It's going to be...lifetime memory for me that I lost my teeth on...'Hunarbaaz' stage," Akash said, adding, "All my...hard work bore fruits and I could win the trophy."

247.title: From the first draft, I knew I wanted Taapsee to do my film: Sudhir Mishra
247.article_body: Discussing his upcoming short film in an untitled anthology produced by filmmaker Anubhav Sinha and Bhushan Kumar, director Sudhir Mishra said, "From the first draft, I knew I wanted Taapsee Pannu to do the film." Taapsee stated that she had a "ball of a time", creating memories of a "lifetime". The anthology is based on stories around the COVID-19 pandemic.

248.title: Over 2,500 differently-abled cricketers register to play for India
248.article_body: The Differently-Abled Cricket Council of India (DCCI) has registered over 2,500 differently-abled cricketers in its registration process drive that started nearly a week ago. The drive is initiated to streamline the process and "bring a system in place" in differently-abled cricket. "All the data collected will be shared with the BCCI which will further be...sent to state associations," DCCI said.

249.title: Russia, Vietnam plan joint military drills
249.article_body: Russia's Eastern Military District has said that the country will hold joint military drills with Vietnam. A meeting was held between the representatives of both countries in this regard. "In the course of the talks, the two parties agreed on the agenda for the upcoming military drills, specifying deadlines and a venue for holding the drills," said Eastern Military District.

250.title: Easy tiger, why do you always fight: Rahul jokingly tells Krishna over fight with Finch
250.article_body: RR fast bowler Prasidh Krishna took to Instagram to share pictures from their match against KKR, which they won by seven runs. Referring to KKR opener Aaron Finch and Krishna's verbal fight in the match, KL Rahul jokingly commented, "Easy tiger. Yakk jagla adtya yavaglu? (Why do you always fight?)"

251.title: Ola CEO dances to 'Bijlee Bijlee' while testing e-scooter's music feature
251.article_body: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal took to social media to share a video of him dancing to 'Bijlee Bijlee' song while testing a feature to play music on Ola's electric scooters. "Doing some final 'expert testing' for the MoveOS 2 music feature," he tweeted. Earlier, he had said that MoveOS 2.0 operating system for scooters will roll out by April end.

252.title: She's amazing: Tiger on getting defeated by 7-yr-old girl in backflip challenge
252.article_body: Tiger Shroff appeared on 'Dance India Dance L'il Masters' to promote his film 'Heropanti 2'. On the show, a seven-year-old contestant, Sanvi Negi, asked Tiger to do a backflip battle with her, however, he was defeated by Sanvi. Reacting to it, Tiger said, "I did try competing with her, but I had no choice but to accept my defeat. She's...amazing."

253.title: Bhumi wins awards for COVID Warrior, 'Badhaai Do' at Asia One Awards
253.article_body: Actress Bhumi Pednekar has been honoured with the COVID-19 commitment Award and the Black Swan Path-Breaking actor award for 'Badhaai Do' at the Asia One Awards. The actress shared a picture of holding the awards on Instagram, writing, "Thank you for the honour #AsiaOneAwards and the distinguished jury that acknowledged our work...This one is dedicated to every covid warrior."

254.title: I work best under pressure but won't worry myself into mess: Arjun Bijlani
254.article_body: Actor Arjun Bijlani said he works best under pressure, but won't have sleepless nights or fret and worry himself into a "mess" for it. "I have never been someone to get bogged down by pressure and numbers," added Arjun. "I have been in the industry [long] enough to not want to take up the same run-of-the-mill roles," stated Arjun.

255.title: GB Nagar reports 107 new COVID cases; 33 children among those infected
255.article_body: Gautam Buddha Nagar reported 107 new cases of COVID-19 and zero deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the health bulletin issued on Tuesday. Of the 107 cases, 33 are school students who have tested positive for the virus, PTI quoted Chief Medical Officer Sunil Kumar Sharma as saying. Now, the active COVID-19 cases in the district reached 411.

256.title: Russia's new offensive will fail, they don't have enough strength: Ukraine
256.article_body: Russia's new offensive in eastern Ukraine is going "very cautiously" but "the battle will not go in Russia's favour", Ukrainian Presidential Advisor Oleksiy Arestovych said. "Their offensive will fail, I give you a 99% guarantee, they simply do not have enough strength," he added. Arestovych also said that Russian forces were trying to find "sensitive spots" in Ukraine's defences.

257.title: Flipkart acquires D2C SaaS platform ANS Commerce
257.article_body: Flipkart has acquired D2C SaaS platform ANS Commerce for an undisclosed amount. The deal is expected to close in the second half of 2022, subject to customary closing conditions. ANS Commerce will continue to operate as an independent business. ANS provides various services to companies and brands looking to sell online, including services that help brands set up digital storefronts.

258.title: Dalits stage protest in Rajasthan over attack on rally on Ambedkar Jayanti
258.article_body: Several Dalits gathered on the streets at Rajasthan's Bharatpur on Tuesday to protest against an alleged attack on a rally that took place on April 14 to mark Ambedkar Jayanti. They alleged that members of Gujjar community attacked them with sticks injuring nine people. Later, a false case of theft was also filed against over two dozen Dalits, they claimed.

259.title: China signs security pact with Solomon Islands amid US' concerns
259.article_body: China said on Tuesday that it has signed a security pact with the Solomon Islands. The pact entails China's assistance in maintaining social order and national security in the Solomon Islands, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Wang Wenbin said. The announcement comes amid concerns by US, Australia and New Zealand about a potential increase in China's military presence in Indo-Pacific region.

260.title: RR debutant McCoy celebrates his first-ever IPL wicket with 'Pushpa' move, video viral
260.article_body: RR debutant Obed McCoy celebrated his first-ever wicket in IPL by doing the 'Pushpa' move. McCoy dismissed KKR wicketkeeper-batter Sheldon Jackson in the last over to bag his maiden wicket in IPL. McCoy went on to pick another wicket in the same over as RR defeated KKR by seven runs. The 25-year-old West Indian registered figures of 3.4-0-41-2.

261.title: Priyanka's co-star Sam shares 'It's All Coming Back to Me' still, deletes later
261.article_body: Actor Sam Heughan shared a still with actress Priyanka Chopra from their upcoming film 'It's All Coming Back to Me' on Instagram. He later deleted the post but the picture has gone viral on social media. Priyanka plays a woman dealing with her fiancé's death and sends messages to his old number which is now owned by Sam's character.

262.title: Akhilesh extends support to Dalit boy who was made to lick feet in UP
262.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav extended support to the Dalit boy who was assaulted and made to lick the feet of an accused as seen in a viral video and promised him admission in Kendriya Vidyalaya. Yadav also ensured safety of his entire family. SP blamed BJP for this incident and said that caste discrimination is "a gift given by BJP".

263.title: 5 held in Himachal after WhatsApp chat indicates paper leak in police exam
263.article_body: Five youngsters from Solan's Arki area were arrested a week after their WhatsApp chat was shared on social media, allegedly indicating that the paper of the Himachal Pradesh Police constable recruitment exam had been leaked. All five had scored marks above 60 out of 80. "Their cell phones have been seized and are being analysed," Solan SP, Virender Sharma, said.

264.title: Suspected drug peddler injured in police firing in Assam
264.article_body: A suspected drug peddler was injured in police firing in Karbi Anglong district of Assam, police said. The accused reportedly tried to escape while being taken to apprehend his associate from Dimapur, police added. "When he refused to stop to our warnings, we had to fire at him and he was injured in...leg," a police officer said.

265.title: World's tallest woman now holds 3 more Guinness records, pics surface
265.article_body: Guinness World Records has announced that Rumeysa Gelgi, considered the world's tallest woman, now holds three more world records. Gelgi, who's 7 feet and 0.7 inches tall, now holds the record for the longest finger (female). Additionally, she holds the record for 'largest hands on a living person (female)'. Gelgi also has the longest back (female), measuring 59.9 cm.

266.title: Economics graduate sets up tea stall after not getting job in Bihar
266.article_body: An Economics graduate, Priyanka Gupta, has been running a tea stall near Women's College in Bihar's Patna after not getting a job in the last two years. The 24-year-old, who is from Purnea district, said she was inspired to run a tea stall from Prafull Billore, who runs a tea shop in Ahmedabad despite having an MBA degree.

267.title: Buttler has 2 tons in IPL 2022, you can expect the same from Rahul: Aakash
267.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said that LSG captain KL Rahul, who slammed a century in their last game against MI, will score another hundred in the ongoing IPL season. "Rahul is in exceptional form. He will not be satisfied with one hundred. Jos Buttler has hit two tons, you can expect the same from Rahul as well," Aakash stated.

268.title: Biden has no plans to visit Ukrainian capital Kyiv: White House
268.article_body: White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki on Monday reiterated that there are no plans for US President Joe Biden to visit the Ukrainian capital Kyiv. The comment comes after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy invited Biden to visit the city. Several European Union leaders have visited the city in recent weeks as a show of support for Ukraine.

269.title: Maha Police begin action against those with cases of communal dispute
269.article_body: The Maharashtra Police have announced a list of steps they said they would take in order to maintain communal harmony amid the ongoing azaan row and the use of loudspeakers in mosques in the state. "Maharashtra Police started taking preventive action against those having cases regarding communal disputes and IPC section 153(A) and 295(A), against them," police said.

270.title: NEET aspirant in Bhopal kills sister-in-law as her son's cries disturbed his studies
270.article_body: A 22-year-old man allegedly stabbed his 25-year-old sister-in-law to death, angry that the constant cries of her two-year-old son disturbed him as he prepared for the medical entrance exam NEET in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, police said. The accused took a knife from the kitchen and stabbed her brutally and killed her on the spot, police added. The accused was arrested.

271.title: Viral pic shows man sleeping on luggage rack of Mumbai local train
271.article_body: A picture of a man sleeping on a luggage rack of a Mumbai local train is going viral on social media. The man in a pair of jeans and t-shirt could be seen sleeping with his eyes covered with a cloth. The picture initially surfaced on Reddit with a caption, "A little jealous ngl."

272.title: He wanted the world to attend his wedding; we had no place to sit: Millind's sister
272.article_body: After 'Bigg Boss OTT' contestant Millind Gaba tied the knot with his long-time girlfriend, Pria Beniwal, in a grand ceremony, his sister Pallavi Gaba shared that it was his dream that the world should attend his wedding. "It was a big fat Indian wedding. We were all wondering where we should even sit, as all...sofas were occupied," she added.

273.title: Huma Qureshi shares her look from chef Tarla Dalal's biopic
273.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi took to Instagram on Tuesday to share her look from a film based on the life of India's first-ever home chef Tarla Dalal. The actress will play the lead role in the upcoming biopic, titled 'Tarla'. Produced by Ronnie Screwvala, Ashwiny Iyer Tiwari, and Nitesh Tiwari, 'Tarla' will be directed by Piyush Gupta.

274.title: 'Pol Khol' campaign vehicle vandalised in Mumbai; BJP blames Shiv Sena
274.article_body: BJP's 'Pol Khol' campaign vehicle, one of the 40 screen-mounted vans, was found vandalised in Mumbai's Chembur on Tuesday morning, the party said. BJP leader Pravin Darekar said that Shiv Sena was behind the attack and asked the police to arrest the "hooligans" involved without delay. BJP uses the vehicle to campaign against Shiv Sena ahead of Mumbai civic elections.

275.title: Security situation in J&K is far better than before: DGP
275.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir DGP Dilbag Singh said that the security situation in the Union Territory is "far better than before". "The security situation is far better...and counter-insurgency operations are being carried out successfully on a daily basis," the DGP said. "There is no doubt that terror elements are doing their actions but those involved...(are) neutralised soon," he added.

276.title: PPCB to penalise Ludhiana civic body for 'failing' to manage solid waste
276.article_body: The Punjab Pollution Control Board (PPCB) on Monday said it will penalise the Ludhiana civic body for its "failure" to manage the city’s solid waste. This comes after fire incidents were reported at the municipal corporation’s primary dumping ground on Tajpur Road for four consecutive days. The PPCB officials observed that the issue was resulting in air and water pollution.

277.title: Seemed wasteful: Musk on Tesla removing mobile connectors with cars
277.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk defended the firm's decision to stop including its mobile connector with new car purchases, saying, "Usage statistics were super low, so seemed wasteful." Tesla will instead sell its charging kit separately for a lower $200 price. Musk added Tesla will "make it easy" to order the mobile connector when purchasing a car.

278.title: Exercise restraint in reporting communal tensions: EGI to media houses
278.article_body: The Editors Guild of India (EGI) on Tuesday urged media houses to exercise restraint while reporting incidents of communal disturbances in different parts of the country. The Guild said that while the desire to be first with the news is understandable, many editors and reporters are reportedly rushing to conclusions without a full appreciation of the facts and context.

279.title: Jaipur woman gets buried under snow in avalanche-prone Himachal area, dies
279.article_body: A 24-year-old tourist from Jaipur, who slipped in an avalanche-prone area and got buried under snow in Himachal Pradesh's Lahaul and Spiti district, died during treatment at a hospital. The woman was roaming near Koksar waterfall when the snow she was walking on suddenly caved in. The district Deputy Commissioner has urged people not to venture near avalanche-prone areas.

280.title: Millionaire asks military to bomb his mansion after Russian forces occupy it in Ukraine
280.article_body: A Ukrainian millionaire asked the country's military to bomb his mansion after he saw it had been seized and occupied by Russian forces. Andrey Stavnitser, the CEO of the Ukrainian IT company TransInvestService, said he saw Russian forces move into his property via a security camera. Stavnitser left Ukraine for Poland after Russia invaded.

281.title: Preity thanks Hrithik for helping out with twins Jai, Gia on flight; shares pic
281.article_body: Actress Preity Zinta took to Instagram to share her picture with actor Hrithik Roshan and thanked him for helping out with her twins Jai and Gia on a long flight. "Thank you so much @hrithikroshan for going out of your way & helping out...Now I see why you are such an amazing & thoughtful father. I love you," she wrote.

282.title: Alia resumes work post-wedding with Ranbir Kapoor; pics surface
282.article_body: Alia Bhatt has resumed work after tying the knot with actor Ranbir Kapoor. The actress was spotted at the Mumbai airport. Reportedly, Alia will be flying to Jaisalmer to complete the shoot for Dharma Productions' film 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'. Pictures have surfaced online, where Alia is seen donning a pink kurta along with a matching dupatta.

283.title: Wasn't expecting Umesh Yadav to smash Boult for 19 runs: Buttler
283.article_body: RR's Jos Buttler said he wasn't expecting KKR pacer Umesh Yadav to smash Trent Boult around in the 18th over of their match on Monday. Umesh came in when KKR needed 38 runs to win in the final three overs and smashed two sixes and a four as KKR scored 20 runs in that over. KKR lost by seven runs.

284.title: Fire breaks out at a shop in Delhi's Kirti Nagar, 15 fire tenders on spot
284.article_body: A fire broke out at one of the shops in West Delhi's Kirti Nagar furniture market on Tuesday, ANI reported citing Delhi Fire Service (DFS) officials. A call about the fire was received around 1:16 pm and firefighting operations are underway. ''We have rushed 15 fire tenders to the spot,'' said DFS Director Atul Garg.

285.title: No chance of communal clashes post-Ramzan in Maharashtra: Minister
285.article_body: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil on Tuesday said there is no possibility of communal clashes erupting in the state after the ongoing month of Ramzan. "Some parties are attempting to create a communal divide in the state...There is no information on such (riots) in the state. However, the police are monitoring the situation closely," Patil said.

286.title: UP government cancels leaves of police personnel till May 4
286.article_body: Uttar Pradesh government has cancelled leaves of all police personnel in the state till May 4. The orders, issued late on Monday night, have reportedly been passed in view of festivals in the coming days. CM Yogi Adityanath has also directed officials to hold dialogues with religious leaders within the next 24 hours to ensure peace during the upcoming festivals.

287.title: 27-yr-old woman stabbed in thigh on New York City subway; suspect at large
287.article_body: A 27-year-old woman was stabbed in the thigh on a New York City subway platform on Monday, police said. The unidentified suspect fled "topside" out of the subway system and has not been arrested yet. The attack comes six days after a 62-year-old man opened fire in a New York City subway car, injuring more than 20 people.

288.title: Ukraine shoots down $15 mn Russian helicopter with $100 missile system
288.article_body: Ukrainian troops shot down a $15 million Russian Ka-52 helicopter by using an air defence missile system worth $100. As per a post shared by the Ukrainian military unit Operational Command 'East', the military unit used an 'Igla', a portable surface-to-air missile (SAM) system that was developed by the Soviet Union. They also shared pictures of the crash site.

289.title: Jason Momoa to star in Warner Bros' 'Minecraft' film: Reports
289.article_body: Actor Jason Momoa is all set to star in Warner Bros' live-action 'Minecraft' movie, according to reports. The upcoming film will reportedly be directed by Jared Hess of 'Napoleon Dynamite' fame. Jason will also be seen in 'Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom', the sequel to the 2018 film 'Aquaman'. The sequel is slated to release in March 2023.

290.title: NCP leader demands arrest of Raj Thackeray over loudspeaker row
290.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader Shaikh Asif said he has written to Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse demanding the arrest of MNS Chief Raj Thackeray over the ongoing loudspeaker row in the state. Thackeray on Sunday had asked to take down loudspeakers outside the mosques saying, "Muslims should understand that religion is not above law and country."

291.title: 'Sanaa' changed me as person & actor: Radhika after wrapping shoot
291.article_body: After wrapping the shoot for her upcoming film 'Sanaa', Radhika Madan said that the film changed her as a person and as an actor. "Sanaa is...the toughest character to let go off. She slowly seeps into your veins and before you know it she has already captured you," Radhika added. "Sanaa will always be closest to my heart," she stated.

292.title: BBMP offers 5% rebate on property tax if people pay it before Apr 30
292.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta has announced that people can get a 5% rebate if they pay their property tax for the 2022-23 financial year before April 30. According to BBMP, property owners would've to pay the full amount in one instalment in order to avail the rebate. The amount can be paid using BBMP's website.

293.title: 4 firearms seized in West Bengal's Malda, Bihar man arrested
293.article_body: Police arrested a resident of Bihar's Munger and seized four firearms from his possession in West Bengal's Malda district. The accused was nabbed at Khaltipur Railway Station on Monday while he was travelling aboard the Katihar-Howrah Express, an official said. He was scheduled to deliver the guns to a person in Kaliachak in the Malda district, the official added.

294.title: 5 labourers from Bengal suffocate to death at K'taka fish processing unit
294.article_body: Five labourers from West Bengal suffocated to death at a fish processing unit in Karnataka's Mangaluru. The incident took place when one of them went inside a 20-foot-deep waste water tank to clean it and got stuck. After he screamed for help, other labourers rushed to help him, but failed. Three of the labourers have been hospitalised for further treatment.

295.title: Shah Rukh's film with Atlee to be made on a budget of ₹200 cr: Report
295.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film with filmmaker Atlee will reportedly be made on a budget of ₹200 crore. "[It will be] the costliest film for Shah Rukh Khan till date after the soon-to-be-released 'Pathaan', which is made on a budget of ₹250 crore," the report stated. Shah Rukh's yet-untitled film with Atlee will reportedly also feature Nayanthara and Sanya Malhotra.

296.title: 'Jayeshbhai...' will change definition of heroism on-screen: Ranveer
296.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has said that his upcoming film 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' will change the definition of heroism on-screen. "Hopefully, [it will] leave an important message to people in the most entertaining and hilarious fashion," he stated. Speaking about his character in the film, Ranveer said, "He is quick-witted and he has his heart in the right place."

297.title: Neither Cong nor NCP, Shiv Sena will dump each other: Cong Minister
297.article_body: Maharashtra Minister of State for Home Satej Patil has said that "neither the NCP nor the Shiv Sena will dump the Congress, nor will Congress" dump them. Patil has also revealed that the state Congress unit has invited senior leader Rahul Gandhi to visit Mumbai. "He (Rahul) is expected in the second week of May," the Congress leader said.

298.title: PMPML marks 'Bus Day' with low fares, high bus frequency
298.article_body: The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) marked 'Bus Day' on Monday with as many as 1800 buses plying on roads and discounted ticket fares for commuters. Dedicated lanes for PMPML buses plying on certain routes were also set up in an effort to avoid traffic congestion. Additionally, female commuters availed free rides within Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad limits.

299.title: B'luru man threatens to expose female friend's HIV +ve status, extorts money
299.article_body: Karnataka Police have filed an FIR against a man who allegedly threatened to expose the HIV positive status of his female friend and also extorted money from her. Reports said accused also extorted gold chain worth ₹2.8 lakh. He told the woman's relatives about her being HIV positive. When questioned, he beat her up and threatened to rape her daughter.

300.title: Odisha hikes daily dietary expenses of prisoners from ₹64 to ₹80
300.article_body: The dietary expense of prisoners in Odisha has been increased from ₹64 to ₹80 per day, the state government said in an official statement on Monday. While the government has also approved the inclusion of Jail Hospitals under the Niramaya Scheme, the user credentials have been generated for 32 Jail Headquarter Hospitals in E-Niramaya Software.

301.title: 1 kg of hand-rolled Japanese tea leaves sells for nearly ₹12 lakh
301.article_body: One kilogram of new hand-rolled Japanese green tea leaves was sold for a record 1.96 million yen (nearly ₹12 lakh) at an auction in Japan on Monday. The hand-finished Samidori leaves are from Japan's Shizuoka prefecture, which is famous for quality green tea. Before this, the record for most expensive tea sold in Japan reportedly stood at 1.08 million yen.

302.title: I thought he is possibly at the end of his career, he surprised us all: ABD on Karthik
302.article_body: Talking about RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik, who has scored 197 runs in IPL 2022 at an average of 197 and a strike rate of 209.57, AB de Villiers said, "The last time I saw him before IPL he was commentating in the UK." He added, "I thought he is possibly at the end of his career...but he surprised us all."

303.title: While keeping, he once said 'Do you want chai, samosa?': Suryakumar on Pant's antics
303.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant's antics behind the stumps, Suryakumar Yadav revealed that once he was fielding in place of Cheteshwar Pujara during a Test against England last year. "I was thinking, 'It's my first time on the field wearing whites.'...The match situation was incredibly tight. Pant suddenly said, 'Do you want some chai, samosas? Do you want anything?'" Suryakumar said.

304.title: Shanti Sethi appointed US Vice-Prez Kamala Harris' defence advisor
304.article_body: US Navy veteran Shanti Sethi has joined US Vice-President Kamala Harris' office as her executive secretary and defence advisor. Sethi was reportedly the first Indian-American commander of a major US Navy combat ship and has also been the senior military advisor to Navy Secretary Carlos Del Toro. Harris' Senior Advisor Herbie Ziskend confirmed Sethi's appointment to Politico.

305.title: Soni shares pic of Ranbir & Alia from their wedding; calls them her 'heartbeats'
305.article_body: Soni Razdan shared a picture of Ranbir Kapoor and her daughter, Alia Bhatt, from their wedding. In the picture, Alia is looking overwhelmed and the veteran actress, couldn't take her eyes off her daughter. Soni had captioned the picture, "My heartbeats." The couple tied the knot on April 14 in a traditional ceremony attended by their families and friends.

306.title: Siraj is a rare breed like Umran Malik, needs specialised role: Ajay Jadeja
306.article_body: Ex-India player Ajay Jadeja has said that RCB pacer Mohammed Siraj should be given a specialised role in the ongoing IPL season. "Siraj is a rare breed like Umran Malik. Their potential is up to how you use them...He could be given three overs upfront," he added. So far, Siraj has picked five wickets in six matches in the season.

307.title: Will perform 'aarti' on loudspeakers at Maha temples on May 3: MNS leader
307.article_body: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) workers will perform 'maha aarti' at their local temples across the state, on May 3, on the occasion of Akshaya Tritiya, MNS leader Nitin Sardesai said on Tuesday. "The aarti will be performed using loudspeakers," he added. His comment comes after MNS chief Raj Thackeray gave May 3 as ultimatum to remove mosque loudspeakers.

308.title: Drones being used for surveillance in Delhi's Jahangirpuri after violence
308.article_body: After a violence broke out during a Hanuman Jayanti procession in Delhi's Jahangirpuri on Saturday, drones are being used for surveillance in the area. DCP (Central district) Shweta Chauhan said, "Delhi Police [is] also keeping an eye at Jama Masjid and Hauz Qazi area in Central district...with the use of drones." A total of 23 people have been arrested.

309.title: Chahal showed how to change the game within one over vs KKR: Malinga
309.article_body: RR bowling coach Lasith Malinga said Yuzvendra Chahal showed why leg-spinners are considered as match-winners by changing the game in a single over against KKR in IPL 2022. Chahal, who posted 5/40 in the match, took four wickets in 17th over, including his maiden hat-trick in IPL. "He's the most experienced leg-spinner in...country and in this tournament," he added.

310.title: Tried slowing him down but he went harder: Ponting on McCullum's 158*
310.article_body: Talking about ex-KKR opener Brendon McCullum's 158* in the first-ever IPL match in 2008, Ricky Ponting who batted at the number three position for KKR in that match said he tried asking McCullum to bat slower. "McCullum...[went] harder and harder and ended up playing an incredible innings," added Ponting. McCullum's 158* comprised 10 fours and 13 sixes.

311.title: Gurugram civic body plans to complete pre-monsoon work by June 30
311.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram has set June 30 as the deadline to complete all the pre-monsoon work in the city, according to an official order. Additional commissioners and joint commissioners have been appointed as nodal officers to prepare for the season. "We're on track to complete...80-85% of all allotted works for monsoon preparedness this year," an official said.

312.title: Insurance scheme for healthcare workers on COVID-19 duty extended
312.article_body: The insurance scheme for healthcare workers who are engaged in COVID-19-related duties has been extended by 180 days from today, the government said in a press release. The scheme, which is under the Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Package (PMGKP), has been extended to "provide the safety net to the dependents of health workers". The PMGKP was launched in March 2020.

313.title: MP govt allots ₹1 cr aid for those affected during Khargone violence
313.article_body: Madhya Pradesh government has allotted ₹1 crore for providing relief to the people affected by the communal violence in Khargone. The financial assistance will be provided as per a survey conducted by the district administration, an official said. Stones were hurled during a Ram Navami procession in Khargone, which led to incidents of arson and communal clashes.

314.title: Badshah to make international debut with 'Voodoo' alongside J Balvin
314.article_body: Rapper Badshah on Tuesday took to Instagram to announce his international debut with Colombian singer J Balvin and Puerto Rican producer Tainy. He shared the album cover and wrote, "Namaste India Colombia Latino Gang! We coming this Friday 22nd April 2022! #Voodoo." Balvin commented "INDIA" along with heart emojis. Canadian singer Tesher, known for his song 'Jalebi Baby', wrote, "Yes!!"

315.title: Leopard climbing tree with prey langur falls to death in MP
315.article_body: A leopard reportedly lost her balance and fell to death while climbing a 25-foot tree with her prey, a langur, in the Pench Tiger Reserve in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni district. The carcasses of both the animals were found on Monday morning. An official said that the leopard, aged around eight to 10 years, had her ribs and backbone broken.

316.title: Kerala temple displays board banning entry of Muslims during festival; protest erupts
316.article_body: Protests broke out after a board outside the Malliyottu Palottu Kavu temple in Kunhimangalam of Kerala's Kannur said that Muslims were not allowed inside the premises during a festival. The board was put up during the Vishu-related festival in the temple, held between April 14 and 19. Last year, a similar message was displayed outside the temple, as per reports.

317.title: Hindi film industry used to ape the West a lot in the 1990s: Raveena
317.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon said the Hindi film industry used to "ape the West" a lot at one point in the 1990s. "They all wanted to become Hollywood with choppers and westernising. There was a loss of Indian culture in our movies," added Raveena. "I...[would] feel that we are going away from what the masses are identifying with," stated Raveena.

318.title: Sonia meets Prashant Kishor at her residence, 3rd meeting in 1 week
318.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi on Tuesday again met political strategist Prashant Kishor at her residence in Delhi. This is their third meeting in a week amid reports of Kishor joining Congress ahead of Assembly polls later this year and the Lok Sabha elections in 2024. Senior Congress leaders Digvijaya Singh, KC Venugopal, Ambika Soni and Randeep Surjewala attended the meeting.

319.title: Woman burns mother's body after killing her over money in Gr Noida
319.article_body: Greater Noida Police have arrested a woman and her husband for allegedly killing her 56-year-old mother over money. The accused reportedly suffocated her to death, later dragged her body into the kitchen and burned it using petrol. They allegedly left the gas open to pass it off as an accident. The deceased had received ₹15 lakh from her insurance policy.

320.title: Fainting woman falls under moving train in Argentina; pulled out alive
320.article_body: A video showing a woman fainting and falling under a moving train in Argentina's Bueno Aires has surfaced online. The video showed the woman being pulled out alive after stopping the train before an ambulance took her away. "I don't know how I'm still alive. I'm still trying to make sense of it all," the woman said.

321.title: Despite poor start he showed intent: Ajay Jadeja on Chahal's 5-wicket haul
321.article_body: Reacting to RR spinner Yuzvendra Chahal's five-wicket haul against KKR which included a hat-trick, ex-India batter Ajay Jadeja said Chahal showed intent to pick wickets despite a "poor" start to his spell. "I am trying to convince people that Chahal's cricketing brain is probably three or four times than who we think has the best brain," added Ajay.

322.title: Mamata best suited to lead opposition, Cong busy with infighting: Ripun Bora
322.article_body: Trinamool Congress leader Ripun Bora on Tuesday said Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee is best suited to lead an opposition front in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "Congress' leaders in various states are fighting against each other rather than fighting the BJP," Bora added. Notably, Ripun Bora joined the TMC on Sunday after quitting Congress.

323.title: Fish with 'dracula-like fangs' washes up on US beach, pics surface
323.article_body: A fish that looked like a 'dracula' was recently found by a beach walker in California, US. It had two Dracula-like fangs that stuck out of its mouth, alongside a large dorsal fin, an elongated body, and huge eyes. Christopher Martin, the curator of ichthyology at the Museum of Vertebrate Zoology, identified it as a lancetfish, reported the Daily Star.

324.title: Brainless trolls, stop digging out old matters: Himanshi Khurana
324.article_body: Actress Himanshi Khurana on Tuesday shared a statement on social media asking the media to "stop digging out old matters" and letting "bygones be bygones". She added that doing so instigates conversations among "brainless trolls" who then "rip through someone's reputation". This comes after a media portal shared an article on an old controversy between Himanshi and actress Shehnaaz Gill.

325.title: India to use semiconductors of $80 bn to make items worth $300 bn: Govt
325.article_body: Union Minister of State for Electronics and IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar has said India will consume semiconductors of about $70-80 billion to manufacture electronics products worth $300 billion by 2026. Of the target of $300 billion in electronic manufacturing, $120 billion is being aimed for export. PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate the first 'Semicon India 2022 Conference' in Bengaluru.

326.title: MP man uses abusive words, mimics PM Modi, Amit Shah; arrested
326.article_body: A 38-year-old man has been arrested in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur for allegedly mimicking and using abusive words against PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah, police said. This comes after a video of the accused performing a mimicry of PM Modi and Shah's walking style went viral. Following this, right-wing organisations had filed a complaint.

327.title: We've had 2 attempts at getting married, COVID knocked us out of park: Cyrus
327.article_body: Cyrus Sahukar said that he and his wife Vaishali Malahara have been together for eight years and have had two attempts at getting married. "But both times Corona has knocked us out of the park...In February, cases were like 23,000 a day...and we were like how can we possibly get married when there's so much stress...in everyone's life," he added.

328.title: Japan to send masks, hazmat suits to Ukraine amid chemical weapon threat
328.article_body: Japan will send gas masks, hazmat suits and drones to Ukraine amid growing concern about the use of chemical weapons by the Russian military. Japan is sending the anti-chemical-warfare equipment at the request of the Ukrainian government, the country's Defence Minister Nobuo Kishi said. Last month, Japan had provided bulletproof vests, helmets and other non-lethal arms equipment to Ukraine.

329.title: Traffic awareness week being held at Pune's Baner till April 23
329.article_body: A traffic awareness week is being observed at the Radha chowk in Pune's Baner from April 18-23. About 10-15 wardens will be deployed in the area for the initiative. "We plan to post these wardens with traffic police at Saikar chowk, Mamta chowk, Nanaware chowk and Ganpati chowk within Baner and Balewadi to smoothen the traffic clog," an official said.

330.title: Youth must learn spirit of sacrifice, commitment from freedom fighters: VP Naidu
330.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Tuesday said India's youth must learn the spirit of sacrifice and unwavering commitment from our freedom fighters. "They must imbibe...values of...honesty, dedication and selfless service," he said. "Remember that these heroes fought not merely for an abstract geographical entity but to free millions of people from oppressive and unjust British rule," he added.

331.title: DC-PBKS match shifted from Pune to Mumbai after 5 DC members test COVID-19 positive
331.article_body: The BCCI has announced that the DC-PBKS match will be held in Mumbai instead of Pune on April 20 to avoid any further incident due to any undetected case during a long-distance bus journey in a closed environment. This comes after five members of DC's contingent, including all-rounder Mitchell Marsh, tested positive for COVID-19.

332.title: Bail denied to jeweller who bought jewellery stolen from Sonam's home
332.article_body: A Delhi court denied bail to a jeweller who allegedly bought jewellery stolen from Bollywood actor Sonam Kapoor's home in Delhi. While rejecting the plea, the court cited police's objection to the bail because some jewellery was yet to be recovered from him. Stolen jewellery worth over ₹1 crore, including 100 diamonds and six gold chains, was recovered from him.

333.title: India world's largest producer of milk; turnover more than wheat, rice output: PM
333.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said India produces milk worth ₹8.5 lakh crore annually, more than the turnover of wheat and rice. "Today, India is the world's largest producer of milk...Small farmers are the biggest beneficiaries of the dairy sector," the PM added. PM Modi was inaugurating a new dairy complex at Banas Dairy in Gujarat's Banaskantha district.

334.title: B'luru Whitefield area to face power cuts from 10 am-5 pm till Thurs
334.article_body: Bengaluru's Whitefield area will witness power interruptions till Thursday (April 21) due to the cabling work by Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited. According to BESCOM, the areas will face power cuts from 10 am to 5 pm. The affected areas include Channasandra, VSR layout, Koralur, Hosahalli, Prithvi Layout, Whitefield Main road, Upkar Layout, Prashanth Layout and Swami Vivekananda Road.

335.title: Woman returning home from work crushed by BBMP garbage truck, dies
335.article_body: A 40-year-old woman bank employee who was returning home from work on Monday was crushed by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike's garbage truck in Bengaluru. The woman was returning from work on a scooter when the garbage truck knocked her down from behind and ran her over. Police have shifted the woman's body to the Victoria Hospital on Mysuru road.

336.title: Rajasthan makes licence mandatory for keeping cows at home in urban areas
336.article_body: A yearly licence and a 100 square yard area will now be mandatory in Rajasthan for keeping cows or buffaloes at homes that fall in urban areas, the state government said. As per the order, penalty of up to ₹10,000 will be imposed on owners if the animals are found straying. However, the rules will not apply to registered gaushalas.

337.title: SP leader booked for threatening to read Quran in front of temples
337.article_body: An FIR has been registered against Samajwadi Party leader Rubina Khanum for allegedly making proactive speeches. Khanum said if no action is taken against groups installing loudspeakers outside mosques to play the Hanuman Chalisa, hundreds of Muslim women would recite Quran in front of temples. Khanum alleged that attempts were being made to target Muslims by banning loudspeakers outside mosques.

338.title: 3 RSS workers held for murder of PFI leader in Palakkad
338.article_body: Kerala Police arrested three RSS workers for the murder of the Popular Front of India (PFI) leader, A Subair, which took place last week in Palakkad, on Tuesday. According to ADGP Vijay Sakhare, the killing of Subair was an act of revenge for an RSS worker's murder in November last year. The accused are identified as Ramesh, Arumughan and Saravanan.

339.title: Bihar govt makes arrangements to quickly ferry kids with AES for treatment
339.article_body: Bihar government has made arrangements of linking an auto-rickshaw with every panchayat to quickly ferry children suffering from acute encephalitis syndrome (AES) to the nearest health facility, officials said on Monday. The arrangements have been made across 12 districts. According to Additional Director (Health), an ambulance has also been attached to every PHC to transport patients.

340.title: Kerala HC refuses to interfere in interfaith marriage
340.article_body: The Kerala High Court on Tuesday refused to interfere in an interfaith marriage between a Muslim man and a Christian woman. It is the woman's will and pleasure, noted the court. The habeas corpus plea demanding the woman to be produced before the court was filed by the woman's father, who alleged that his daughter had been illegally detained.

341.title: I was completely terrified, my heart was racing: Suryakumar on Kohli sledging him
341.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli sledging him in an IPL 2020 match, Suryakumar Yadav said, "His sledging was on another level." "I was chewing gum and looked composed...but on the inside I was completely terrified. My heart was racing," he added. "The voice inside me was screaming [to myself], 'Bro I beg you, please don't say anything'," Suryakumar further stated.

342.title: Ukrainian soldier escapes death as his phone stops bullet fired by Russians
342.article_body: A purported video has surfaced on social media that showed a Ukrainian soldier pulling out a smartphone from his pocket that had a bullet lodged inside it. The soldier had a narrow escape from death as the clip showed the smartphone with a 7.2 mm bullet, that was fired by the Russian troops at him, peeking from its one end.

343.title: IMF appreciates India's help to Sri Lanka amid its worst economic crisis
343.article_body: The chief of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) has appreciated India's help to Sri Lanka in the country's fight against its worst economic crisis since independence. Kristalina Georgieva also assured Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman that the financial institution will continue to actively engage with the island nation. India has sent diesel and petrol and offered financial aid to Sri Lanka.

344.title: SBI asks FRL about steps taken to get back stores from Reliance: Report
344.article_body: State Bank of India (SBI) has written a letter to Future Retail (FRL) seeking accountability on the takeover of the company's stores by Reliance Industries, BloombergQuint reported. SBI has asked FRL what steps it has taken to safeguard lenders' interests and the efforts taken to get back its assets from Reliance. Reliance took over 947 Future Group stores last month.

345.title: Big B shares fan artwork day after defending another fan's work
345.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan on Monday shared fan-made artwork on Instagram showing him and his son Abhishek Bachchan's faces over cartoon bodies. This comes a day after one of his fan pages criticised artwork done by another fan account saying the creator shouldn't use the actor's face over someone else's body. Amitabh had tweeted, "I like it...Please do...more...Don't pay attention to others."

346.title: Ashwin said 'I was too busy in shoots', then bowled 3 hours in nets: Kaif
346.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has praised RR spinner Ravichandran Ashwin, stating that the 35-year-old is a "genuine wicket-taker, who keeps adding new things". "Ashwin was with me at DC...and I remember...[a] game at the Wankhede [where] he leaked many runs...He felt he was too busy in shoots...[and then] bowled for almost three hours in the nets," recalled Kaif.

347.title: Cong seeks disqualification of its two Rajkot corporators for joining AAP
347.article_body: The Congress has written to the Commissioner of the Rajkot Municipal Corporation requesting him to disqualify two Congress corporators who joined AAP last week. Congress' Rajkot city unit President Pradeep Trivedi alleged that the duo, Vashram Sagathiya and Komal Bharai, were elected as corporators on Congress tickets and therefore, they should be disqualified for joining another party.

348.title: Lay down your weapons immediately: Russia to Ukraine forces
348.article_body: Russia has called on Ukrainian forces to "immediately lay down arms". This comes as Russia launched a new offensive in east Ukraine. Meanwhile, blasts were also heard in Kharkiv in the northeast, Mykolaiv in the south and Zaporizhzhia in the southeast while air raid sirens were also going off in main centres near the front line, officials and media said.

349.title: SBI hikes lending rate by 0.1%, EMIs to go up
349.article_body: India's biggest lender State Bank of India (SBI) has hiked the marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by 10 basis points, or 0.1%, across all loan tenors. With the increase, EMIs will go up for those borrowers who availed loans on MCLR. After the SBI, Kotak Mahindra, and Bank of Baroda, Axis Bank also announced an increase in MCLR.

350.title: 8 injured as 2 TMC groups clash near MP's house in Kolkata; 6 arrested
350.article_body: A clash broke out between two groups of the Trinamool Congress (TMC), who had been trying to take control of the construction business in a locality in Kolkata's Lake Gardens area.
