Six persons have been arrested in connection with the incident, which left at least eight injured. The incident took place near TMC MP Sougata Roy's residence.

351.title: Scientists name new millipede species Nannaria swiftae after Taylor Swift
351.article_body: Scientists have discovered 17 new species of millipedes living in Appalachian Mountains of the US and named one of them Nannaria swiftae after singer-songwriter Taylor Swift. As per the scientists, the species is named after Taylor "in recognition of her talent as a songwriter and performer and in appreciation of the enjoyment her music has brought [scientist Derek Hennen]".

352.title: No safe corridors agreed for third straight day: Ukraine Dy PM
352.article_body: Ukraine's Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk on Tuesday said that the country was for the third straight day unable to secure Russia's agreement to establish any humanitarian corridors to evacuate trapped civilians. She added that "difficult negotiations" were taking place to try to arrange humanitarian corridors in the southern region of Kherson and in the Kharkiv region of eastern Ukraine.

353.title: Chef found part of Depp's finger in kitchen: Doctor on actor's fight with Heard
353.article_body: Amid Johnny Depp's defamation lawsuit against ex-wife Amber Heard, the actor's doctor said that a chef found part of Depp's finger in the kitchen, where the two were fighting. Depp told hospital workers he cut himself with a knife, the doctor said. Earlier, Depp said Heard threw a vodka bottle at him, which led to the finger getting cut off.

354.title: Nothing to say: Ex-Twitter CEO on why he didn't do anything about 'dysfunctional' board
354.article_body: After former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey tweeted that their board has "consistently been the dysfunction" of the company, a US journalist argued why he hadn't done anything about it when he ran the firm. Replying to him, Dorsey tweeted, "So much to say…but nothing that can be said." Dorsey's remarks come amid Tesla CEO Elon Musk's offer to acquire Twitter.

355.title: Allu Arjun rejects a large amount to endorse tobacco product: Report
355.article_body: Actor Allu Arjun has declined to become the face of a tobacco company despite being offered "a hefty sum", according to a report. "He rejected it without a second thought as he personally doesn't consume it. [He] doesn't want his fans to watch the ad and start consuming the product, which can lead to addiction," Pinkvilla said quoting a source.

356.title: Tripura govt orders mass execution of pigs amid African Swine Fever outbreak
356.article_body: After Mizoram, Tripura government has now detected cases of African Swine Fever (ASF) at an Animal Resources Development Department-run breeding farm in the state. Over 60 pigs reportedly died due to unknown reasons, raising an alarm about the virus. Following the detection of cases, Tripura has ordered a mass execution of pigs in different phases.

357.title: Don't want to play friend who drives hero to girlfriend’s house: Anant Vidhaat
357.article_body: Actor Anant Vidhaat said that he does not want to play the role of a friend who drives the hero to his girlfriend's house. "I better engage myself doing theatre than doing those roles," he said, adding, "After Sultan, I was mostly getting roles of hero's friend." Anant said that Yash Raj Films gave him a good platform.

358.title: Boney Kapoor shares throwback pic of Arjun Kapoor and Janhvi Kapoor
358.article_body: Boney Kapoor took to Instagram on Tuesday to share an old picture of Arjun Kapoor and Janhvi Kapoor. "Arjun and Janhvi in a playful mood in Burlington (Vermont, USA) during the shooting of our film 'KHUSHI'," he captioned the post. 'Khushi', starring Fardeen Khan and Kareena Kapoor, was released in 2003. The film was produced by Boney.

359.title: Kiara Advani visits the Golden Temple as she shoots for her film RC 15
359.article_body: Kiara Advani, who's currently shooting for her upcoming film 'RC 15', in Amritsar recently shared a post from her visit to the Golden Temple. Taking to Instagram, Kiara shared two pictures of herself standing with her hands folded in front of the shrine. The actress donned a white kurta paired with a yellow dupatta. Alongside the post, she wrote, "Gratitude."

360.title: Waive penalties against Amrapali homebuyers: SC tells banks
360.article_body: The Supreme Court has directed banks to waive penalties against Amrapali homebuyers with outstanding loans and standardise their accounts. "No penalty will be charged from the homebuyers by banks since the default was on part of the builder and not by the buyers," the bench said. In 2019, the court cancelled the registration of Amrapali Group for defrauding homebuyers.

361.title: Sounds high: Musk on Meta spending $26.8 mn on Zuckerberg's security
361.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk in response to a story on Meta spending $26.8 million on CEO Mark Zuckerberg's security in 2021 said, "Sounds high." The figure was reportedly 6% higher than $25.3 million spent in 2020. Private travel and costs associated with security protocols due to the COVID-19 were cited as reasons for such costs in 2021.

362.title: 4 kids injured in Chhattisgarh as Anganwadi building's tiles fall on them
362.article_body: As many as four children were injured at an Anganwadi in Chhattisgarh’s Bhainsbod, after tiles of the building fell over them, Janmejay Mahobe, Balod DM and Collector, said. "We'll look into the cause...Repair work will be done wherever it’s required at the Anganwadis," Mahobe added. A meeting was held to review the condition of the Anganwadis, Mahobe stated.

363.title: Indian economy will be worse than Sri Lanka, Ukraine with riots politics: Raut
363.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that India's economy will be worse than that of Sri Lanka and Ukriane with the "politics of riots". "In big cities of the country...the way situation is tense or such a situation has been created, it's highly unfortunate...Riots are happening in national capital. Delhi is a centre-administered state...it is a union territory," he added

364.title: Japan invents electric chopsticks that make food seem 1.5 times saltier
364.article_body: Japanese researchers have developed electric chopsticks that enhance the taste of salt in food by 1.5 times to reduce sodium levels in the food. The device that comes with a mini-computer worn on a wristband, uses a weak electrical current to transmit sodium ions from food via chopsticks to the mouth, thus creating a sense of saltiness, a researcher said.

365.title: Anuj, Suyash have created positive impact on games: Maxwell
365.article_body: RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell has praised teammates Anuj Rawat and Suyash Prabhudessai for their performances in the ongoing IPL season, stating that the youngsters have "created a positive impact" on the games despite not scoring too many runs. Rawat, who is RCB's opening batter, has scored 125 runs in six matches while Suyash has scored 40 runs in two games.

366.title: PM failed to achieve targets of economic growth in 8 yrs: Subramanian Swamy
366.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP and BJP leader Subramanian Swamy said in eight years in office, PM Narendra Modi has failed to achieve targets of economic growth. "On the contrary, the growth rate has declined annually since 2016," Swamy tweeted. "Modi inexplicably is clueless about China. There is scope to recover but does he know how?" Swamy added.

367.title: IMD predicts cloudy sky with light rain in Delhi on Wednesday and Thursday
367.article_body: Following heatwave conditions on Tuesday, the IMD has predicted a "generally cloudy sky with light rain or drizzle" in Delhi on Wednesday and Thursday. The maximum temperature is likely to decrease from 42°C on Tuesday to 41°C on Wednesday and 39°C on Thursday. The IMD has predicted thunderstorm and lightning over Western Himalayan region and adjoining plains during April 19-21.

368.title: Netherlands head coach Ryan Campbell in induced coma following heart attack
368.article_body: Netherlands head coach and ex-Australia wicketkeeper Ryan Campbell is in induced coma in ICU in UK after suffering a heart attack. The 50-year-old was at a playground with his children when he collapsed. "[We're] in shock to hear of Ryan's medical emergency after suffering a major heart attack over the long weekend," Western Australian Cricket Association CEO Christina Matthews said.

369.title: Go First flight to Delhi stopped at Srinagar airport after bomb call
369.article_body: A Go First flight was halted at the Srinagar airport on Monday after a manager of another airline received a call about a bomb on board, PTI reported. The flight was headed for New Delhi. Inspector General of Police Vijay Kumar said the plane was searched but no explosives were found, adding that the incident was being investigated.

370.title: Had suggestions in Thar, he rejected it; did it his way: Anil on Harsh Varrdhan
370.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor said that while he was shooting for 'Thar' with son Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor, he had some suggestions. "But he rejected it. He did it in his own way, and he was right and I was wrong. I really enjoyed working with him," Anil said, adding that Harsh Varrdhan is fearless and he is proud of him.

371.title: Massive fire breaks out at plastic factory in Ludhiana, 2 severely injured
371.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a plastic factory in Ludhiana on Monday evening and two labourers, aged 18 and 40, were severely injured, officials said. The victims had suffered third-degree burns on their face, chest and legs, a hospital's deputy medical superintendent said. "It took around half an hour to bring the flames under control," an official added.

372.title: Wherever there is encroachment, bulldozers should be used: MoS Lekhi
372.article_body: Minister of State for External Affairs Meenakashi Lekhi on Tuesday said that bulldozers should be used to remove encroachments. "Whenever there is an encroachment on public property, it's important to remove it," Lekhi said. Talking about Delhi's Jahangirpuri incident that took place on Hanuman Jayanti, Lekhi said, "It's a conspiracy...to promote enmity to hamper law and order."

373.title: More hepatitis cases in young UK children likely to emerge: WHO
373.article_body: The UK is likely to see a rise in cases of hepatitis in young children in the coming days, the World Health Organisation (WHO) said. Recently, UK reported 74 hepatitis cases. Out of these, some children were transferred to specialist liver units, while six underwent liver transplantation. "The cause of...current hepatitis cases is...unknown and remains under active investigation," WHO added.

374.title: China to send next new space station crew for 6 months in June
374.article_body: China will launch three more astronauts to its newest space station in June for a period of six months. The crew will add two modules to the station, Director of the China Manned Space Engineering Office said. The core module of the Tiangong was launched in April 2021. China plans to complete the station by end of this year.

375.title: Siblings aged 3 & 6 drown in canal in Pune; bodies recovered
375.article_body: The bodies of two siblings, aged three and six, were recovered on Monday night after they drowned in a canal in Pune's Sortapwadi. Police believe that the children were riding a bicycle near the canal and had fallen in after losing control. The children's family had found the bicycle and footwear at the banks of the canal during a search.

376.title: Brain-dead patient's kidneys, lungs and liver donated to save 4 lives in Mumbai
376.article_body: The kidneys, lungs and liver of a critical patient of CritiCare Asia Multi-Specialty Hospital in Mumbai were donated, which saved the lives of four other persons. The patient's organs were transplanted to other hospitals in the city. The family members of the donor, who was declared brain-dead on March 26, were counselled to opt for organ donation.

377.title: KTR inaugurates Skywalk at Mindspace campus in Hyderabad
377.article_body: Telangana Municipal Administration Minister KT Rama Rao on Monday inaugurated a one kilometre long Skywalk at Hyderabad's Mindspace campus. The Skywalk connects the Raidurg Metro Station to strategic locations in and around the Mindspace Madhapur campus and is expected to ease commute for around 30,000 people on a daily basis. It has been designed keeping in mind people with disabilities.

378.title: Attacking police station is serious crime: Bommai on Hubbali stone-pelting incident
378.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said that the investigation into the stone-pelting incident at Old Hubbali Police Station, in which 12 policemen were injured, is being carried out thoroughly. "Attacking the police station is a serious crime, action will be initiated against the guilty," he added. According to Hubbali Police commissioner, 88 persons have been arrested in the matter so far.

379.title: Temple shut to prevent groom's entry in MP: Scheduled Caste body
379.article_body: A Scheduled Caste organisation on Monday claimed that "influential people" had closed a temple in a village in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain to prevent the entry of a groom, who's a police constable. However, a police officer said that the Rajput community submitted documents claiming they had built the temple and it was closed due to the priest's family member's death.

380.title: I know we lost but keep your chins up: Shah Rukh Khan after RR defeat KKR
380.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan motivated his IPL team Kolkata Knight Riders as it lost to Rajasthan Royals on Monday. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "Well played boys. Stupendous effort by @ShreyasIyer15 @AaronFinch5 @y_umesh congrats to #SunilNarine for the 150th match...I know we lost but if we've to go down this is the only way to do it! Keep your chins up."

381.title: Zilingo board considering replacing Indian-origin CEO amid probe: Report
381.article_body: Singapore's fashion startup Zilingo's board is discussing replacing Indian-origin CEO Ankiti Bose after suspending her earlier this month amid an investigation into the startup's accounting practices, Bloomberg reported. Bose, whose current suspension runs through May 5, has reportedly asked the board to clarify her status. The board has not yet decided who will replace Bose.

382.title: California teen with autism who went missing 3 years ago found alive
382.article_body: A California teenager who went missing nearly three years ago was found alive on April 9, sleeping in a convenience store in Utah's Summit County. Connerjack Oswalt was reported missing in September 2019, when he was 16 years old. Oswalt has now been reunited with his family, "who was losing hope", Summit County Sheriff said in a Facebook post.

383.title: 3 explosions hit school in Afghanistan
383.article_body: Three explosions hit a school in Afghanistan's Kabul on Tuesday, killing several people, according to Afghan security and health officials. There was no immediate claim of responsibility for the attack. Many residents in the neighbourhood belong to the Shia Hazara community, an ethnic and religious minority frequently targeted by Sunni militant groups, including Islamic State.

384.title: Will Ram Navami processions be taken out in Pak if not in India: Giriraj
384.article_body: Union Minister and BJP leader Giriraj Singh asked if Ram Navami processions should be taken out in Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan if not in India. "Had processions of any other faith...been attacked, leaders like Rahul Gandhi and ailing (RJD President) Lalu Prasad...would have hit the streets for their political tourism," he added.

385.title: Afghanistan gets 30 tonnes of food and relief supplies from UAE
385.article_body: Afghanistan received 30 tonnes of food and relief supplies from the UAE amid the humanitarian situation in the country. An aircraft carrying the supplies reached Kabul on Monday. A Taliban spokesperson reportedly said that the supplies will be distributed among the vulnerable people by the government. He further called for unconditional aid, devoid of any political motive.

386.title: Ram Charan gets mobbed by fans in Amritsar, video surfaces
386.article_body: Ram Charan, who was most recently seen in 'RRR', was mobbed by fans in Amritsar, where he's shooting for Shankar's project. In a video, the actor can be seen surrounded by fans, who're chanting his name loudly. Reacting to the video, a fan wrote, "Man of...masses," while another fan wrote, "Can't wait to see similar visuals in London, New York."

387.title: Silly mistakes and not handling pressure well cost us game vs RR: McCullum
387.article_body: KKR head coach Brendon McCullum said a couple of silly mistakes and not handling pressure as well as they should have, cost them the game against RR. "We were trying to hold Cummins for the seamers...Mavi's role was to...get through [Yuzvendra Chahal]. Unfortunately, we weren't able to execute [that]," he added. RR's Chahal picked four wickets in KKR's 17th over.

388.title: Instagram rolls out product tagging for public account users in US
388.article_body: Instagram has enabled tagging products in feed posts for all public account users in the US. In a blog post, Instagram explained how the feature would work and said that the idea behind this is to support small businesses and help them get traction. The platform also said they are working on ways for users to tag products in Stories.

389.title: Jack Ma's Ant to be payments platform 2C2P's largest shareholder
389.article_body: Jack Ma-owned Ant Group will become the majority investor in Singapore-based payments platform 2C2P as part of a partnership. The deal will lead to the integration of Ant's Alipay+ payment service with 2C2P's platform used by merchants in Asia, Europe, the Middle East and the Americas. "Through this...partnership...2C2P will be connected to a much larger merchant base," 2C2P CEO said.

390.title: Man, others beat wife, force her to marry alleged lover in Tripura
390.article_body: A woman was allegedly beaten up and forced to marry her "lover" on suspicion of having an extra-marital affair in Tripura's Khowai, police said on Monday. The woman told reporters that her husband along with 15 others had thrashed her until she lost consciousness. The police haven't received a written complaint, but will investigate the matter, a police officer said.

391.title: 5 of family from Rajasthan killed, 2 missing as car falls into canal in Punjab
391.article_body: Five members of a family from Rajasthan were killed as the car they were travelling in was hit by a speeding bus and fell into a canal on Ropar-Chandigarh Highway in Punjab, police said. The search to recover the bodies of two others is on, police added. "After collision...driver lost control...ended up hitting the railing of the bridge," police stated.

392.title: Bride slaps groom twice, storms off stage during jaimala ceremony in UP; video goes viral
392.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing a bride slapping the groom twice and walking off the stage during jaimala ceremony in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur district. As per reports, the bride did not like the groom. Local police intervened to bring the situation under control, reports added. The two sides later reached an agreement, reports further stated.

393.title: Pakistan President refuses to administer oath to new cabinet: Reports
393.article_body: The oath-taking ceremony of the new Pakistan federal cabinet has been postponed after President Arif Alvi reportedly refused to administer the oath to them. A notification revealed the names of 30 federal ministers who were to take oath in PM Shehbaz Sharif-led federal cabinet. Imran Khan was removed as Pakistan PM after he lost the no-trust vote against him.

394.title: MP govt land worth ₹300 crore free from encroachment in Bhopal
394.article_body: Madhya Pradesh government's land worth ₹300 crore has been freed from encroachment in Bhopal, an official said on Tuesday. A woman had been allegedly selling shops, that were constructed illegally on this land, and an FIR will be filed against her, an official statement said. The encroached land was in the Chuna Bhatti area, the statement added.

395.title: Mandakini to make a comeback after 26 years, to star in son's music video
395.article_body: 'Ram Teri Ganga Maili' actress Mandakini, who quit the film industry in 1996, is making a comeback with a music video, which will also feature her son Rabbil. The song is about a mother and is titled 'Maa O Maa', director Sajan Agarwal said. "[It's] a very beautiful song and I instantly fell in love with it," Mandakini said.

396.title: Mumbai man gets ₹7.5 lakh prize money letter, ends up losing ₹16 lakh
396.article_body: A 32-year-old Mumbai-based man had received a postal letter, which mentioned a lucky draw from a known online shopping portal with a scratch card in it. On scratching the card, it showed that he had become a lucky winner of ₹7.50 lakh cash prize. The accused induced the victim to pay ₹16 lakh in order to claim the prize.

397.title: Destroyed foreign weapons stored near Ukraine's Lviv city: Russia
397.article_body: Russia carried out airstrikes at a logistics centre of the Ukrainian Army near Lviv city and destroyed large quantities of foreign weapons stored there, Russia's Defence Ministry said. The weapons had entered Ukraine in the last six days from America and European nations, it added. In total, 16 Ukrainian military sites were destroyed by Russia on Monday, it further said.

398.title: Deleted, was creating chaos: MP BJP chief's wife on Hindu-Muslim unity tweet
398.article_body: Madhya Pradesh BJP chief VD Sharma's wife Stuti Mishra said that she has deleted her tweet on 'Hindu-Muslim unity' because it was creating "unnecessary chaos". "It's difficult to share thoughts on a topic of religious fight. Was not [aimed] to hurt anyone's opinion. Let karma do the rest," she said. She had earlier tweeted about a "caring" Muslim shopkeeper.

399.title: PM Modi-led govt’s ‘Swachh Bharat’ campaign changed lives of people: BJP
399.article_body: The Centre has built toilets in over 11.5 crore households under the 'Swachh Bharat' mission, the BJP said on Monday. PM Narendra Modi has worked to fulfil Mahatma Gandhi’s dreams about cleanliness and has effected change in the lives of people, the BJP stated. PM Modi launched the campaign on October 2, 2014.

400.title: UP govt allows maximum 1 month casual leave for employees infected with COVID-19
400.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has issued orders allowing its employees to go on a special causal leave, if infected with COVID-19. As per the order, employees infected with COVID-19 can be given the special leave for a maximum period of one month. The order mentions that this leave can be incurred by infected employees at any time.
